loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, salt, kapenta and sugar to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is single and has an electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell to her customers. Gloria has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell to her customers

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati is 40 years old, married, and blessed with three sons. She is a rural woman who hails from Maynaguri. Though she is illiterate, she is an active and energetic woman who is engaged in an incense business to help her family financially. One of her sons is a student of grade 10, and others are day laborers. They live in their own house in Khagrabari, a small village in Jalpaiguri district.

Her husband, 43-year-old Pranesh, is a mason. He has been doing this for many years now. He does shuttering work for building construction. He uses wooden boards and metal plates supported by rods to create molds. The molds hold the concrete in place as it sets, thereby creating a solid, smooth structure.

Her husband wants to provide a better service to his clients in construction work. This is why he wants to buy materials to improve his work. This way, he will have more work and therefore a higher income, which will improve his family's quality of life.

Malati has sought a loan from BJS to purchase wood for her husband's shuttering business. She wants to provide her family a quality life and wants to give higher education to her son. They are thankful to Kiva and its field partner BJS.

loans.use: To purchase wood for her husband's shuttering business.

loans.name: Thandiwe

texts.en: Thandiwe resides in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the wellbeing of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, to sustain her economic independence, she is a farmer who grows crops like beans and vegetables. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  With the Kiva loan, Thandiwe will purchase fertilizer, seeds and insecticides to increase production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds and insecticides to increase production.

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
36-year-old Basanti hails from the village of Bagnan in Jalpaiguri district. She is married and a mother of three school-going children (one son and two daughters). She is illiterate, and can sign her name only. Her illiteracy cannot curb her spirit and dedication to provide a better life to her children. She helps support her family of five by rearing cattle. Her children are her greatest motivation, for whom she works tirelessly.

Basanti's husband is a cycle-can puller who has no fixed income. This was the reason that Basanti started livestock breeding to provide her children with food, health and education. She rears a dairy cow and sells the milk in her locality. The money she earns is spent for the food expenses. She, therefore, feels the need to have a better income and thereby higher savings, to stabilize her financial independence.

She applied to BJS (a Kiva partner) for a loan to purchase a dairy cow. There is always a demand for cow milk and she believes her monthly income will increase through this purchase. The loan will enable Basanti and her family to have a secure and dignified life and the best education to her children.

She is thankful to the lenders for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to continue her milk supply business.

loans.name: Bharati

texts.en:
Bharati lives in the small village of South Mouyamari in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal. She is 32, and a young and energetic entrepreneur. She is married and mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Her children are students of grade 9 and grade 4, respectively.

Her husband is a cycle-van puller who uses a hired van. That is why his income is so scant that it can hardly cover their food cost. Bharati has a small dairy farm from where she supplies milk to different households in their village every day. She has to work really hard in order to support her family and to bear her childrens' educational expenses.

Therefore she has planned to buy another cow to generate more income. Through this she will be able to serve more households, and therefore increase her sales. Bharati has applied for a loan from Kiva through BJS to help her with his business.

She hopes that this investment will help her to gain additional income to fulfill her dream of giving higher education to her children.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Don Rigoberto es un padre de familia, el desea poder crecer su negocio para poder mejorar los ingresos de su esposo ya sus hijos. el necesita de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para poder comprar el equipo necesario para mejorar su soda y dar un mejor servicio a los clientes. Con esto espera mejorar su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Rigoberto is a father who wants to grow his business so that he can improve his income for his wife and children. He needs a loan of 1,000,000 CRC so that he can buy the necessary equipment for improving his soda (snack) shop. This would allow him to provide better service to his customers.

With this loan, he hopes to improve his business and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his soda shop.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret is a 42-year-old single woman who supports a family of three children and has been selling leather hand bags for eight years earning her an income of 15,000 KES every month.

Magret is now servicing her fourth loan of 45,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy additional leather hand bags to add to her stock which is running out.

Magret plans to use the anticipated income to open another handbag shop and hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy additional leather hand bags to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 60 years old and married. He and his spouse have been blessed with four children. He sells groceries such as tomatoes, vegetables, onions, and bananas. He has been in this business for 15 years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

He will use this loan to buy more inventory of tomatoes, onions, and vegetables. He will be able to serve more customers and make more income which he will use to expand his business.

This is his fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and he has paid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes and dreams are to open a big grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items.

loans.name: Alieska Maria

texts.es:
Los altos deseos de superación corren por la piel de Alieska, una joven de 23 años de edad, caracterizada por conseguir lo que se propone y cuyo sueño es convertirse en una contadora pública como su padre. Afortunadamente lo está logrando, pues lleva el cuarto año de la carrea de Contaduría pública y finanzas, con excelentes notas académicas dado que además de tener la influencia de su papá, quien es contador, siempre le han apasionado los números. 
Alieska siempre se ha sentido motivada por su papá, pues es su modelo a seguir y quien la ha apoyado siempre en alcanzar sus sueños, gracias a su trabajo en una cooperativa de servicios múltiples. En estos momentos ella solicita un préstamo para pagar la mensualidad de sus estudios y su título universitario. Esto le permitirá alcanzar uno de sus objetivos de convertirse en una profesional y encaminarse estudiar en un futuro un maestría.
texts.en:
23-year-old Alieska exudes an enthusiasm and drive to succeed. She is characterized by the fact that she gets what she sets out for. Her dream is to become a public accountant like her father.

Fortunately, she is doing just that since she is in her fourth year of Public Accounting and Finances. She has excellent grades thanks to the influence of her dad, who is an accountant, and her passion for numbers.

Alieska has always been motivated by her dad. He is her role model, and he always supports her pursuit of her dreams, thanks to his work at multiple cooperative services. She is requesting a loan to make her monthly payments for school and to pay for her diploma. That will enable her to fulfill one of her goals of becoming a professional, and it will put her on the road to pursuing a Master's degree in the future.

loans.use: to make her monthly payments for school and to pay for her diploma

loans.name: Velez

texts.en:
Velez is 35 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Velez works very hard to provide for them.

Velez runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stock of products to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, soy sauce, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, noodles, and shampoo.

In the future, Velez would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of supplies to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional piglet, feeds and other supplies for her business. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Maricel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Antehwe Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Antehwe Group and it is comprised of two hard-working women. They are into the sales of smoked fish.

Rose is 55 years old and lives in the town of Teshie, in the greater Accra region of Ghana. For the past 17 years, Rose has been working hard, selling smoked fish. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan from ID Ghana. The loan will be used to buy more fish and firewood to sell smoked fish to customers. This loan will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her son. 

Rose hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand her business. The members will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish and firewood.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 33-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years. She has 3 cows for milking. She sells the milk in her neighborhood. 

Shameem's  business is doing well enough to give her a decent life. She has three children. She is very motivated to provide them with good education, food and clothing. It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase another cow for milking. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing higher living standards to her children.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Angie Tatiana

texts.es: Angie necesita un préstamo de trescientos cincuenta mil colones (350.000) para poder comprar el equipo necesario para establecer una soda y empezar a vender comida. Es una mujer emprendedora que quiere seguir adelante a su familia. El tener una soda prospera para que la economía del hogar sea mejor.
texts.en: Angie needs a loan of three hundred and fifty thousands colones (350,000) to purchase equipment needed to start selling soda and food. She is an enterprising woman who wants to move forward with her family. Having a soda fountain that is prosperous will lead to a better household economy.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for a soda fountain and restaurant

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 30 años habita en Malambo con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, en las edades de 4 a 10 años, donde se dedica a la venta de dulces y mecatos, o alimentos empacados al vacío,  como papitas, chitos, platanitos, mentas chicles  etc. Hace algún tiempo Julio compró una vitrina de oportunidad  y su esposa al verla, le propuso que incluyera en ella dulces para venderlos a los vecinos. Así empezó su negocio y hoy se ha convertido en una fuente de ingresos importante para su familia, pues vende de lunes a domingos, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Comprando en el centro de la ciudad a sus principales clientes, que son sus vecinos y transeúntes. Su meta es mejorar los ingresos y la imagen del negocio, con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Aunque su mayor desafío es obtener fuentes de financiación. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen, dulcería y alimentos empacados, para aumentar su volumen de ventas y hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Julio is 30 years old and lives in Malambo with his wife and their 3 children, who range in age from 4 to 10 years old. To make his living, he sells sweets and snacks, or vacuum-packed foods, such as potato chips, salted peanuts, dried bananas, mint gum, etc.

Some time ago, Julio happened to buy a glass display case, and when his wife saw it, she suggested that he put sweets in it to sell to their neighbors. That's how his business started, and today it has because an important source of income for his family. He operates Monday through Sunday from 8am to 8pm. He is near the city center and mainly sells to his neighbors and passers-by.

His goal is to increase his income and improve his business' image, in order to improve his family's quality of life. His biggest challenge is finding sources of funding.

For this reason, he is requesting a Kiva loan, his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy sweets and packaged foods wholesale, so he can increase his sales volume and make his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and packaged foods

loans.name: Julio Miguel

texts.es:
Julio Miguel tiene 43 años de edad, no tiene hijos bajo su responsabilidad, vive en la casa de sus padres, él se dedica a la agricultura, la casa del Julio Miguel se encuentra en el distrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Julio Miguel se dedica al cultivo de arroz, desde hace 10 años, en el caserío de Cuyca. Julio Miguel desea el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de peones para la instalación en su cultivo de arroz. Con esto incrementará los rendimientos de su cultivo. Él posee conocimientos en el negocio por lo que se asegurá que será una buena inversión.
texts.en:
Julio Miguel is 43 years old and has no children under his responsibility. He lives at the home of his parents. Julio Miguel works in agriculture. His house is located in the District of Colasay in Jaén Province, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Julio Miguel has been growing rice for 10 years in the village of Cuyca. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy fertilizers and pay the workers who will be planting the rice crop. As a result, he hopes to increase the output from his crop. Julio Miguel is knowledgeable about his business, so he gives his assurance that this will be a good investment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay the workers who will be planting the rice crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to grow coffee and vegetables

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es: Don Marvin es un señor mayor que quiere seguir adelante con su familia, para eso necesita hacer unos arreglos en la cocina de la soda donde prepara los alimentos. el necesita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para poder realizar estos arreglos. El desea un mejor futuro para su familia y para él.
texts.en: Marvin is an older gentleman who wants to move forward with his family. For that, he needs to do some repairs in the kitchen where he prepares food. He needs a loan of one million colones (1,000,000) to make these arrangements. He wants a better future for himself and his family.

loans.use: to make kitchen repairs in his restaurant

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 41 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with four children. She sells fish and has been in this business for 12 years.  She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of fish to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en: Angeline is a 30-year-old businesswoman living in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. She rents a shop where she sells grocery products and shoes. With the Kiva loan, Angeline will increase her stock to improve sales and profits. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. An increase in profits will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock to improve sales and profits.

loans.name: Jacqueline De Jesus

texts.es: Para Jacqueline, mejorar los ingresos generados por su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia son sus principales metas. Ella habita con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 1 y 11 años y se dedica a la actividad comercial, la que  desarrolla desde hace 3 años, cuando inició su negocio, al dejar de trabajar para una empresa y tomar la decisión de acudir a lo que más le gustaba : “El comercio”. En la actualidad Jacqueline está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, accesorios femeninos, con el fin de incrementar sus inventarios y hacer que su credikiva tenga un efecto positiva en su negocio como inversión
texts.en:
Jacqueline's main goals are to increase her business' earnings and improve her family's quality of life.

She lives with her husband and their 2 children, who are 1 and 11 years old. She works as a saleswoman, which she has done since she started her business three years ago. She left her job at another business and decided to start doing what she most loves: sales.

Jacqueline is requesting a Kiva loan, her fist loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to purchase clothes and women's accessories, intending to increase her inventory and make sure that her Kiva loan has a positive effect on her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and women's accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a television

loans.name: Kakii

texts.en:
Kakii is a 27-year-old woman married to Michael who adds additional income to support their family's welfare. They are blessed with one child.  Kakii has been operating a clothing shop for five years, earning her an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.

Kakii is now servicing her second loan of KES. 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy more materials and dresses to sell to her customers.

Kakii plans to use the anticipated income to educate her child and hopes to have a successful life with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy more materials and dresses to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home system

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “REYNA DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yovana  ella es casada y tiene 45 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.


El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de ladrillos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en:
These members are part of the communal bank Reyna del Carmen. This bank is located in the Cusco district, which is part of the Cusco province and the Cusco department.

Yoyan is the featured borrower for this loan. She is 45 years old, and she is married and has 3 children. She selling clothes for a living, including pants, blouses, and polo shirts. She has worked in this business for many years now, and it is very successful. Her dream is to own a shop where she would sell stationery.

She is requesting a loan to purchase shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

The member that is pasted into the group photo had his picture taken after the meeting because he asked for permission due to work obligations.

The other members work in the restaurant business and clothing, brick, and grocery sales.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 34 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children. She also supports four members of her family. She has a movie shop and has been in the business for seven years. She also does a catering business.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she plans to use it to purchase more stock of movies to sell. She will also use the loan to open a hotel and also do her catering business from the same place. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business. Lucy has successfully repaid her previous loans and her future hopes are to open a restaurant, establish a catering company and also improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more movies to sell.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
Jose Santos tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo, vive en casa propia en el centro poblado Huacapampa, distrito de Cañarís, dicho distrito esta dedicado a la agricultura cultivando café de la variedad catimor. La casa Jose Santos se encuentra en el distrito de Cañarís, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Jose Santos se dedica al cultivo de café, desde hace 10 años en el centro poblado menor de Huacapampa. Él necesita el crédito para comprar de abonos para el mantenimiento de su finca y asi asegurar una buena cosecha ya que manteniendo sus fincas Jose Santos obtendrá mayores rendimientos y mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose Santos is 28 years old and lives with his wife and their young son. They live in their own house in the town center of Huacapampa, Cañarís district. This district is dedicated to farming, specifically the Catimor variety of coffee. Jose Santos' home is in the Cañarís district, Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque region, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

Jose Santos has worked as a coffee farmer for the past 10 years. He needs this loan to purchase fertilizer to maintain his farm in order to ensure a good harvest. Then he will have output and higher earnings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to maintain his farm and ensure a good harvest

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en: SIXTY Two-year old Reuben does not boast of a university degree or even a certificate from an agricultural institute, but he is a village celebrity in his own right. Based in Nyamarambe, which is a remote village in the rich highlands of the Kisii area of Kenya, he is involved in dairy, poultry and maize farming. He engages in milk and egg production for commercial purposes, as opposed to many rural farmers who are in it for subsistence. These commercial activities place him in a better position to engage in other agriculture-related businesses, which, in fact, he does. Reuben is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cow shed. This will help significantly in managing the animals’ health and hygiene. He has been in the farming business for at least 24 years. He has no plans to quit in the future, as he finds farming to be not only fulfilling, but also lucrative. However, his biggest challenges are the poor road network and lack of market. With your loan, Reuben will construct a cow shed, which will later come in handy when he scales up and introduces zero grazing. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to his children’s education.

loans.use: to build a cow shed.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married lady, age 28, with two children. She resides in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. She is a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae organization who encourages economic independence to young women. She is also a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students at the local secondary school about issues related to their wellbeing, such as how to handle peer pressure. She is currently running a business selling kitchenware in a shop. She is applying for a loan so that she can expand her business and pay fees for her children and young sisters. With the Kiva loan, Esther will purchase more plates and tissues to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more plates and tissues to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Emiliene

texts.en: Emiliene is 43 years old and married with eight children between 5 and 25 years of age. All of them go to school. Her husband is a construction worker and she sells food stuffs. She has been working for the past 18 years in the same business. With the loan, she would like to buy beans, sorghum and Irish potatoes for sale.  She wishes to improve her business and triple the amount of stock she currently has. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy beans, sorghum and Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Ishema Cb Group

texts.en:
Vestine is a group leader, aged 42 years. She is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 18, and all of them go to school. The group is called Ishema, which means “proud of” in English. The members sell different items, but they have the same vision of improving their standard of living. 

Vestine has owned a shop for almost four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, rice, biscuits and beans to sell. She will reinvest the profit in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more soap, rice biscuits and beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for her corn crop.

loans.name: Christophe

texts.en:
Christophe is 42 years old and he is married with 3 children between the ages of 6 and 18. All of them go to school. He has been farming for 14 years, and he will use Kiva`s loan to buy fertilizers for rice production. With the profit from his farming, he would like to buy more fertilizers in order to get more productivity.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Cristian Ramon

texts.es: Cristian de 60 años de edad, es la propietario de una droguería, ubicada en la población donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijas en las edades de 19  a 28 años. En el año 2012, Cristian inició esta actividad habiendo observado a muchos de sus amigos que se dedicaban a ella; con un capital y la ayuda de uno de estos, inició su negocio con mucho entusiasmo., En su punto comercial vende productos farmacéuticos, de contado y directamente al consumidor, trabajando de lunes a domingos,  desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Sus principales clientes están ubicados en la comunidad donde habita, Cristian  tiene como meta principal,  mejorar la imagen del negocio, haciendo adecuaciones y con un cerramiento que mejore su seguridad  y la de  los que ingresan. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,   mediante el cual comprará rejas y artículos constructivo, para que su farmacia luzca cada vez mejor.
texts.en:
Cristian is 60 years old.  He owns a drug store, which is located in the town where he lives with his wife and their four children, who are 19 to 28 years old.  In 2012, Cristian started this business after seeing many of his friends work in the same area.  With capital and help from one of his friends, he started his business enthusiastically.  At his business, he sells pharmaceutical products for cash and directly to the consumer.  He works from Monday to Sunday, from 8:00am to 8:00pm.  His main customers are located in the community where he lives.  Cristian's goal is to improve the image of his business by making repairs and installing a gate to improve his security and that of those who enter his store.  

He is requesting his first Kiva loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase bars and construction materials so that his pharmacy shines more each time.

loans.use: to purchase security bars and construction supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a chaff-cutter  and a water tank

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 59 years old. He is married and has five children between the ages of 12 and 33, all of whom go to school. He has been farming for 15 years, he will use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizers for rice. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Rialyn

texts.en:
Rialyn is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rialyn is 35 years old.

Rialyn has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. She requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Rialyn has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.es: María, tiene 33 años de edad, está en una relación de unión libre con su esposo, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el municipio de La Másica, Atlántida. Hace 4 años que estableció su propio negocio de una pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica como ser, arroz, maíz, frijol, azúcar, sal, harina, café, manteca, churros, refrescos, jabón, etc. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para invertirlos en la compra de  mas productos para surtir como granos básicos, harina, manteca, azúcar, pan, productos lácteos, refrescos, churros, pan, huevos, etc. Tiene como meta mejorar el negocio para que aumenten sus ventas y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old and is in a civil union. She and her partner have 2 children, and they live in the city of La Másica, Atlántida.

Four years ago, she started her own business, a grocery store to sell basic stables such as rice, corn, beans, sugar, salt, flour, coffee, butter, churros, soda, soap, etc.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL to stock her store with basic grains, flour, butter, sugar, bread, dairy products, soda, churros, eggs, etc.

Her goal is to improve her business to increase sales and support her family.

loans.use: to stock her store with basic grains, flour, butter, sugar, bread, dairy products, soda, churros, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Bahtishahe

texts.en: For the third time, Bahtishahe is requesting a loan through Kiva-KosInvest. She has been very happy with her previous loans, both of which have helped her to improve the living conditions of her family. Now, she is requesting a loan in order to put a new façade on her house and be able to finally complete her home. She is very happy to have this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: To put a new façade on her house and be able to finally complete her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes to increase and open her clothing store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Yegbadjimawo

texts.fr: Mariée  âgée de 61 ans, Yégbadjimawo  est mère et  a  un enfant  en charge dans le quartier de Bè. Elle fait le commerce comme activité avec  l’achat  et  vente des poissons frites. Yégbadjimawo  s’approvisionne quatre(4) fois  par mois au grand marché de lomé et revend à la devanture de son domicile. Yégbadjimawo sollicite un prêt pour  agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Yégbadjimawo is 61 years old, married, and she has one child under her care.  She lives in the neighborhood of Bè.  She works in retail, buying and selling fried fish.  She stocks up four (4) times per month at the Grand Market in Lomé, and then resells her goods in front of her house.  Bella is requesting a loan in order to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of fried fish.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a father of two children and lives in the western part of Kosovo. He is a very well-known taxi driver in the area and supports his family, making a living by transporting customers around in his vehicle. From all of the driving he does, his vehicle has suffered from the wear and tear of daily use and is in need of repairs.

 Islam is asking for a loan to help him to make the necessary repairs, allowing him to be able to continue with his business and providing income to his family. His goal is to be able to expand his business and eventually own a taxi business of his own. He is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To make the necessary repairs for his taxi veichle

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 24-year-old entrepreneur. She lives in the Mwenezi District of Masvingo   Province in Zimbabwe. Esther lives with her husband and her two children. She has been volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Esther goes door-to-door selling clothing. She has been running her business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.   

With the Kiva loan, Esther will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to increase her inventory by purchasing more stock

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children;  two go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for two years. She works six days a week.

Hasifa has requested a loan from MCDT-SACCO of Ugandan shillings 300,000 to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenges include fluctuating prices of clothes. Her future goal is to buy a plot of land and build a house.She lives in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Darlys

texts.es: Darlys de 31 años de edad se dedica a la venta de productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, negocio que inició hace 2 años, después de aprender de la experiencia de su madre como comerciantes, y haber recibido los primeros artículos de ella para que los vendiera entre sus amistades con quienes trabajaba. Una vez Darlys quedó desempleada, acudió a su principal saber y se vinculó a una empresa para promover sus productos mediante catálogos. Hoy su afán de crecer es aún mayor, pues sus ventas las realiza a crédito, y para tener un capital de fondo con el cual seguir trabajando y  aprovechar las ofertas que su revista trae, requiere un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación mediante el cual comprará accesorios de plástico, como jarras y otros recipientes de uso doméstico, impulsando así el incremento de sus  ventas, en tanto a que su principal propósito es lograr estudios de calidad para que sus hijos sean exitosos.
texts.en:
Darlys is 31 years old. She works selling products through merchandise brochures and catalogs. She started her business two years ago after learning through her mother’s experience as a merchant, and received her first articles to sell among her friends with whom she worked. Once Darlys became unemployed, she turned to her main expertise and became associated with a company to promote their products through catalogs.

Today her eagerness to grow is even greater. She needs a Kiva loan because her sales are made on credit and needs to have a working fund with which to continue working and to take advantage of offers magazines bring. This is her first loan that she has had from Foundation so she can buy plastic products such as jars and other containers for domestic use, thus encouraging an increase in sales while her primary purpose is to provide a quality education for her children to become successful.

loans.use: to buy plastic products such as jars and other containers for domestic use

loans.name: Illuminee

texts.en: Illuminee is 57 years old. She is married and has four children, aged between 18 and 30, all of them go to school. She has been selling sorghum for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for five children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 30 years old. She is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She is requesting a college tuition loan for herself, which will itself facilitate her in repaying back the loan easily. She believes that after graduating she will have enough variety of skills which will help her in her entrepreneurship development.

loans.use: To pay for college tuition fees.

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Claude is 41 years old.  He has four children aged between 16 and five.  He is married to a businesswoman. 

Claude plans to finish his studies in 2015, but despite his determination and ambition, he is lacking financial support. Thus, he would like to request  a loan to facilitate his studies by covering tuition and fees, so that he becomes stable in his studies. 

After he graduates, he plans many projects, like supporting his fellow Rwandan men and women in achieving a better education.

loans.use: to pay tuition and fees for his studies.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 44 ans Kossiwa est mariée et mère de cinq(5)  enfants  résidant à Adidogomé. Elle fait de la restauration en vendant du riz accompagné de spaghetti et des oeufs. Elle  s'approvisionne 4 fois par mois au marché de Totsi pour l’achat du riz,spaghetti,oeuf et d’haricot et après préparation elle revend à la devanture de son domicile. Kossiwa sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son stock afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
At 44 years old, Kossiwa lives in Adidogomé, is married, and is a mother of five children. She works selling prepared rice and spghetti and eggs.

She procures her goods four times a month in the Totsi market--buying rice, spaghetti, eggs, and beans. After she prepares this food, she resells it in front of her house.

Kossiwa is seeking a loan in order to increase her stock and earn a larger profit.

loans.use: to buy one sac of rice, three boxes of spaghetti, and five trays of eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops in the upcoming season.

loans.name: Dyna

texts.en: Dyna is 44 years old. She is married with two children between 17 and 20 years old, one of whom goes to school. She has been selling groundnuts for 21 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more groundnuts for sale. The profit from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more tracksuits, shirts, and hats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 27-year-old mother of one child. She lives in Buhera District, Zimbabwe. 

Judith is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer who mentors secondary school students. In addition, Judith rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products, such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family. She was trained to be an entrepreneur and she is using the acquired skills to earn a living. 

With the Kiva loan, Judith will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and it will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts.

loans.name: La Sagesse Group

texts.fr: La cliente Geneviev est une commerçante, trésorière et membre d’un groupe communautaire «La Sagesse», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 50 ans, divorcée et mère de 3 enfants, dont 1 étudie et 2 sont encore gosses. La cliente est vendeuse de la boisson. Elle installe ses marchandises dans une buvette sur rue de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son ancien mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 12 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir de s’approvisionner en 80 caisses de bière Primus. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The affiliate Genevieve is a merchant, treasurer and member of "La Sagesse" community group. She is a dynamic, 50-year-old entrepreneur, and a divorced mother of three children, one of whom attends school and the other two are still infants.

The affiliate sells beverages, and displays her goods at a stand in one of the city's streets. She started her business with the help of her former husband.

Later, she was granted a loan from the Hekima MFI, and has been running her business for the past 12 years. This new loan will serve to re-supply with 80 cases of Primus beer.

Her aim is to educate and feed her children. Finally, she is very thankful to  Hekima for empowering non-bankable women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical post-conflict period in the Eastern part of the country.

loans.use: re-supply with 80 cases of Primus beer

loans.name: La Source Group

texts.fr: Anne est commerçante, dynamique, entrepreneur depuis 34 ans est membre d’une Association d’Affaires «La Source», âgée de 59 ans, mariée et mère de 12 enfants, qui tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires  dans un dépôt à son domicile sur l'avenue animée de la ville. Son conjoint est un retraité. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter de braises, huiles de palme, beignets, épices etc. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, nourrir ses enfants et préparer leur avenir. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Anne is a dynamic merchant and entrepreneur with 34 years experience. She is a member of the business group La Source. She is 59 years old, married, and a mother of 12 children, who all have education. Her husband is retired.

Anne works selling basic foodstuffs from her home in town. She started this business from funds she received from her husband. 

She is seeking a loan with Hekima in order to expand her business. She is going to buy charcoal, palm oil, beignets, spices, etc. 

In the future, she would like to increase her capital, feed her children and prepare for their future.

She thanks Hekima for their support of female entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, palm oil, beignets, spices, etc.

loans.name: Estaurofila

texts.es:
Estaurofila tiene 46 años, es conviviente, y conocida en el medio, por la labor de crianza y venta de animales menores. Vive en casa propia, con su cónyuge y nieta de 06 años, quien estudia en jardín nacional de Cayaltí, cónyuge trabaja en empresa agrícola de la zona. Estaurofila cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Tiene una familia unida. Vive en una comunidad habitada por gente amable y respetuosa, que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Estaurofila se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, como cerdos y patos desde hace más de 05 años aproximadamente. Ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de ganado caprino. Dicha inversión le generará mayor ingresos a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Estaurofila is 46 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and is known for her work raising and selling small animals.  She lives with her husband and their 6 year old granddaughter, who is in the national kindergarten of Cayaltí, in a house that they own.  Her husband works for an agricultural business in the region.  Estaurofila has good personal and professional references.  She has a a very close family.  She lives in a community in which the people are kind and respectful, and work in business, agriculture and livestock.  This community is located in the Cayaltí district in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

Estaurofila works raising and selling small animals such as pigs and ducks.  She has done so for over five years.  She is in need of this loan to purchase goats.  This investment will generate greater incomes for her family.

loans.use: purchase goats.

loans.name: Sara

texts.fr: Agée de 22 ans  Sara est célibataire sans enfant  résidant à Adidogomé. Elle a commencé son petit commerce en  vendant  des œufs. Elle s'approvisionne 4 fois par mois dans un dépôt à djidjolé et revend par vente ambulante à dans les environs de son quartier et à domicile.  Sara  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
At 22 years old, Sara is single and without children living in Adidogomé. 

She has started a small business where she sells eggs.

She procures her goods four times a month from a warehouse in Djidjolé. She then sells from her home and by traveling around her neighborhood.

Sara is seeking a loan to expand her business so that she can satisfy her customers and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy 18 trays of eggs

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans Eugénie est mariée et mère de trois(3) enfants  résidant à Adidogomé. Elle fait de la restauration en vendant du riz. Elle  s'approvisionne 3 fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé pour  l’achat du riz,de spaghetti et d’haricot et après préparation elle revend à la devanture de son domicile sous un hangar. Eugénie sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son stock afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
At 33 years old, Eugénie lives in Adidogomé, is married, and is a mother of three children. She works selling prepared rice.

She procures her goods three times a month at the Adidogomé market--buying rice, spaghetti, and beans. After preparing the food, she resells it in front of her home under an overhang.

Eugénie is seeking this loan in order to increase her stock and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy three sacs of rice, three boxes of spaghetti, and two drums of vegetable oil

loans.name: J Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is aged 29. He is married with three children aged between 8 and 6 years old. All of them go to school. He sells food stuffs and has been running in a business for four years. 

With the loan requested, he would like to buy banana, cassava, beans, and millet for sale. The profit from the business will be used to reinvest, improve her standards of living, and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy banana, cassava, beans, and millet for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock and boost sales

loans.name: Senada

texts.en: Senada is a wife, a homemaker and the mother of two children. Her husband has employment in the construction business, but it is with very low salary.  He has been fortunate enough to own land that he plants wheat and corn on to harvest and sell at a profit. It is because of this extra agricultural business, that he has been able to provide adequately for his family’s daily needs. Recently, they have been able to start building a new home for their family, but it has not yet been completed and progress on it is slow. Senada is in need of a loan in order to purchase the new doors and windows. This will be a major step towards the completion of the house, making their dream of living in a comfortable environment become a reality. She is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase the new doors and windows for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: Jeannette a 44 ans, divorcée et mère  avec 2 enfants en charge à Adidogomé. Elle fait le petit commerce en vendant des céréales, des produits alimentaires et pour diversifier son commerce elle ajoute des ignames. Elle s'approvisionne 2 fois par mois au marché de Sotoboua et revend sous un hangar  au à domicile. Jeannette sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Jeannette lives in Adidogomé. She is 44 years old, divorced, and a mother of two children who are under her care. 

Jeannette works selling cereals, food products, and to diversify her shop, she is adding yams. She procures her goods twice a month from the Sotoboua market and then resells them from home out of a shed.

Jeannette is seeking a loan to expand her business so that she can earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy three calebasses [containers made out of hollowed-out calabashes] of yams

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla is a 22-year-old businesswoman from Buhera District, Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer at the local secondary school, and she also operates a poultry project. Over the last year, Priscilla has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 30 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She started the business because she wanted to be financially independent.  Priscilla would like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets to begin an artisanal fisheries business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more firewood and palm oil

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 48 years old. She is married with seven children aged between 22 and 5 years old; five of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been running a business for the past 12 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used for goats and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 30 years old. She is married with two children aged 10 and 4 years old. She sells potatoes and has been selling for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve the standards of her living and buy land for cultivation.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi a 55 ans, célibataire et mère  avec 1 enfant en charge à Adidogomé. Elle fait le petit commerce en vendant des bois de chauffage plus en plus  qui devient rare et des fruits pour diversifier son activité. Elle s'approvisionne 2 fois par mois au marché de Tovegan et revend sous un hangar  au à domicile. Afi sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Afi is 55 years old, unmarried, and the mother of one child to support in Adidogomé. She has a small-scale business selling firewood, which is increasingly becoming scarce, and fruit to diversify her business. She gets her supplies twice a month at the Tovegan market and resells her products in a shed at her house. Afi is requesting this loan to expand her business in order to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy firewood and fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cosmetics such as lotions, creams, and deodorants among other items.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos, y vive con su pareja, hijos y su madre en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua. Ella se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo. Cultiva café, malanga, y mandarina. Esta actividad la realiza hace 11 años en su propiedad iniciando con la producción de granos básicos, siendo su principal producción el café lo que le genera mayor ingreso. La producción que saca la vende en el mercado de la zona. Ha solicitado varios prestamos a la institución para mantener bien a su finca, actualmente solicita otro por 20,000 lempiras el cual invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para asistir la producción de café. Su plan es sembrar una parcela de café para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old, has five children and lives with her husband, children's and mother in a neighborhood in the city of Taulabe, Comayagua.  She works as a farmer with her husband.  They grow coffee, taro, and tangerines.  She has worked in this field for 11 years on her plot of land.  She started growing basic grains, with her main crop being coffee, which earns her the most.  She sells her harvest in the local market.  

She has received a few loan from this institution to help properly maintain her farm.  She is now seeking a loan for 20,000 lempiras that she will use to purchase manure and fertilizers to care for her coffee.  Her plan is to plant a parcel of coffee for her children.

loans.use: purchase manure and fertilizers to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock and increase sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more maputi, flour, sugar, salt, soap, and royco to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Glaube

texts.fr: Agée de 27 ans  Glaube est célibataire sans enfant  résidant à Adidogomé. Il a commencé son petit commerce en  vendant  des obergines. Il s'approvisionne 3 fois par mois au marché d'Assahoun et revend à son emplacement au marché d'assiyéyé.  Glaube  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
27-year-old Glaube is single with no children, and lives in Adidogomé. He began his business by selling eggplants. He resupplies three times a month at the Assahoun market and resells in his stall at the Assiyéyé market.

Glaube is requesting a loan to expand his business, so he can satisfy customers and make more profit.

loans.use: buy 7.5 bags of eggplants

loans.name: Isata Confort

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Isata, who is married and has one dependent living with her for schooling. In 2007, Isata established her drinks (hard and soft) business to help in taking care of the home. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 Sierra Leoneans (SLL) every month.

Isata is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to purchase more drinks for resale. In the future, she plans to extend her business and open another outlet. Very hard working,  Isata thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Assanatu

texts.en: This is 46-year-old Assanatu. She is married and has two children ages 23 and 19 years. In 2012, Assanatu established her rice, cement, and building materials business. She began her business to help her husband support the home and family. Her business is located in outskirts of the city and her main customers are men and women. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Assanatu requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of rice, cement and building materials to sell. She hopes that this loan will help her expand her business and get more profits so she can adequately take care of her needs. In the future, Assanatu plans to support her children’s education to university level and improve her business. Assanatu thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice, cement and building materials to sell.

loans.name: Nyirarusiro

texts.en:
This borrower is 30 years old. She is married with five children between the ages of 8 and 12 years old and all of the children go to school. 

She sells potatoes and has been running the business for the past seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes for resale.  The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes  for sale.

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en: Daphrose is 57 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 37 and 17 years. One of her children goes to school. She sells Irish potatoes and she has been working for the past 35 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more Irish potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Bellancile

texts.en:
Bellancille, aged 49 years, is married with four children aged between 5 and 13; all of them go to school. She has been farming for 11 years. With her Kiva loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers for rice production. The profits from the business will be used to buy domestic animals such as cows and goats for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mohamed Billoh

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has two children, aged five and one. 

In 2004, Mohamed established his engine oil and provision business. He began his business because he wants to take care of his family. His main customers are adults. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL to buy different types of engine oil. He hopes that this loan will add to his present stock and increase his profit. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to import engine oil. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase different types of engine oil.

loans.name: Felicite

texts.en:
Felicite is 36 years old; she is married with three children aged between 4 and 13, and all of them go to school. She has been farming for eight years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for rice. The profits from farming will be used to buy a plot of land for rearing cows.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es:
En el municipio de La Dorada, habitan muchas personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras con las ganas y fuerzas para salir adelante y luchar por un buen futuro; una de ellas es Maria, una mujer que con su carisma y gran capacidad de trabajo ha podido superar varios obstáculos que se le han presentado a lo largo de su vida.

Tiene un pequeñísimo negocio de fabricación y venta de artesanías en su propia casa, oficio que inicio como un hobbie pero que poco a poco se convirtió en una fuente de ingreso real para el sostenimiento de su familia
Ella, siendo una madre muy responsable, tiene un gran corazón y energía para su familia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales como pinturas, papel especial y otros materiales para fabricación y creación de sus obras.

Con estos elementos podrá mejorar el proceso de fabricación de sus obras, que son vendidas principalmente en almacenes, ferias, y algunos habitantes del municipio.
texts.en:
Many entrepreneurs and hard workers who are eager to get ahead and fight for a better future live in the city of La Dorada.  One of these women is Maria, who with her charisma and work ethic has been able to overcome many obstacles that she has faced throughout her life.  She has a very small business making and selling crafts from her home, a business that she started as a hobby but little by little turned into a real source of income for her family.  Being a very responsible mother, she has a big heart and a lot of energy for her family.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase materials such as paint, special paper and other materials to make her crafts.  With these supplies, she will be able to improve her process for creating her crafts, which she primarily sells in stores, fairs and to some residents of her town.

loans.use: purchase materials such as paint, special paper and other materials to make her art.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Nor Kharberd village with her husband and little daughter Arevik (in the photo). 

Mariam is a cosmetologist with a higher education background and 12 years of working experience. 
Currently Mariam provides different types of cosmetological services to locals in the village living in Nor Kharberd village. She provides high quality service to her customers working from her house. 

Unfortunately the small room where Mariam provides her services needs to be improved with new supplies. She has requested this loan to purchase a special cosmetic chair, materials and equipment needed for providing cosmetics service, and also to pay for cosmetology courses. 

Mariam has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with flexible conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for supplies (a special cosmetic chair, materials and equipment) needed for providing cosmetics service, and to pay for cosmetology courses

loans.name: Elizafani

texts.en: Elizafani is 44 years old and married with 5 children aged between 16 and 6 years old; all of them go to school.He has a shop and has been working in a business for the past 6 years. With the loan, he would like to buy clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en: Getrude is a 21-year-old businesswoman. She is a single with no children. Currently she lives in the Mwenezi District in Zimbabwe. Getrude lives with her mother and her young sisters and brother. Getrude has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the wellbeing of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Getrude goes door-to-door selling bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business since last year and it has enabled her to support her family.  With the Kiva loan, Getrude will purchase more items to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store.

loans.use: to purchase more items to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Chernor Amadu

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Chernor, who is single.  In 2008, Chernor established his business selling engine oil and assorted food in order to establish his independence. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month. 

Chernor is requesting a loan of Le 5,000,000 to buy additional food items such as bread, milk, mayonnaise and  eggs. He hopes that this loan will add to his present stock and increase his profit. 

In the future, Chernor plans to buy land and provide opportunity for the children he hopes to have. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for bread, milk, mayonnaise and eggs

loans.name: Nozipho

texts.en:
Nozipho is a 29-year-old entrepreneur and mother of two children. She lives in the Nkayi District in Zimbabwe. Nozipho has been in the business of selling groceries in her community for three months. Apart from running her business, she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide and motivates other young women to be economically independent. 

With this loan from Kiva, Nozipho will expand her business by increasing her stock, which will lead to more sales and profits. With the additional profits she will earn, Nozipho intends to open a grocery shop and create employment opportunities for the people of her community.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 23 years old and lives in Buhera District, in Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide and teaches life skills to secondary school students.

 In addition, Catherine rents a table at the local flea market, where she sells such products as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for eight months now, and it has enabled her to support her family. 

With this Kiva loan, Catherine will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs. 

Catherine would also like to assist vulnerable children in her community.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for materials to produce high-end beaded bracelets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 34 year old Zainab.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 17, 12 and 2. 

In 2010, Zainab established her rubber (plastic containers) and pan set business. She began her business to assist her husband with financial problems.

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more rubber items and pan sets. 

In the future, Zainab plans to expand her business, to educate her children to a higher level and to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rubbers (plastic containers) and pan sets.

loans.name: Jyambere Cb Group

texts.en:
Nasarie, 56, is a group leader. She is married with nine children aged 29 to 38 years old. One of her children goes to school. 

The group is called Jyambere, which means “go ahead” in English. The members sell different products but have the same goal of improving their businesses by 70 per cent. 

Nasarie sells vegetables and has been selling for the past 20 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more vegetables to sell. The profits from her business will be used to buy goats and sheep.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mirian. B.

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Mirian. She is married and has two children aged 15 and 7 years. In 2012, Mirian established her boutique men's and women's wear business. She began her business because she wanted to take care of herself and the children. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about SLL 400,000 every month from this business. 

Mirian requires a loan in order to purchase more clothing for resale. Mirian would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits and help her to improve her business. 

In the future, Mirian plans to educate her child. Competition and the rainy season are her big challenges. This business has helped her to raise her children. She is looking forward to funds that will help her to develop her business so that she will save enough for her retirement. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 25-year-old businesswoman from Buhera District, Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer who mentors secondary school students. In addition, Evelyn operates a retail business. She rents a table at the local flea market and sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts.

With this Kiva loan Evelyn will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store.

loans.use: to purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts

loans.name: Discipline Group

texts.en:
Millicent, who is in her mid-30s, is married and has two children who are in school. She has been selling African wax-prints for eight years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Millicent's third loan from ID Ghana. She used her previous loans and repaid. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use the loan to buy African wax-prints to sell to her customers. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva's support. 

Millicent will share this loan with her loan group, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy African wax-prints to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Trinity

texts.en:
Trinity is a 22-year-old businesswoman from the Nkayi District of Zimbabwe. She is a single mother of one child, but she also supports two additional dependents. Trinity is a committed Camfed Learner Guide and, as such, she delivers sessions on life skills to young students. When she is not volunteering, Trinity runs her business. She began selling basic commodities once she realized that people in her community traveled long distances to buy them.

A loan from Kiva would mean that Trinity could purchase more groceries to sell. She would earn more profits and be able to financially support her family and further her education. Trinity is specifically interested in training to become a nurse.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Abadacogora Cb Group

texts.en: Drocelle is 42 years old. She is married with five children aged between 17 and five years, and all of them go to school. She is the leader of a group called Abadacogora, which means “courage people” in English. She sells cows and goats and she has been selling for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cows and goats for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more cows and goats for resale.

loans.name: Ottilia

texts.en:
Ottilia is a 30-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has two children in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer at the local secondary school, where she mentors young students. When she is not volunteering, Ottilia is operating a poultry project at her homestead. Over the last six months, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 25 broiler birds every six weeks to sell to local residents. She started her business in 2013 because she wanted to be financially independent and because she saw that it was very profitable in her community.

Ottilia would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production

loans.name: Bijaya

texts.en:
Bijaya is 31 years old and an active borrower of BJS. She lives in Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district with her husband and three children (one son and two daughters). She attended school until eighth grade, and after that she had to give up education due to her parental poverty. Two of her children are attending school, and one is an infant.

Bijaya's husband, 34-year-old Bhupen, has been running his own business of stone for many years. He supplies stone to the building contractors. He studied up to grade three. Life’s pressures and difficulties forced him to leave school in order to support his family of five. He is the sole person responsible for managing the household and fulfilling the demands of each family member. He is trying hard to improve his work, and financial help is very important for him to guarantee his family’s future and cover all their needs and expenses.

He wants to increase his business by purchasing more stones for his business use, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to buy these products. Therefore, Bijaya has applied for a Kiva loan from BJS. With the help of this loan, she will provide financial assistance to her husband so that he can buy business merchandise from wholesalers of stone and fulfill his business needs.

Her goals are to provide better education to her children. Bijaya is very thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase stones for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en:
Tsitsi is a young businesswoman from Buhera District, Zimbabwe. Tsitsi is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer who mentors secondary school students. In addition, Tsitsi rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Tsitsi will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business, and it will allow her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies

loans.name: Hemanta

texts.en:
Hemanta is a married woman of 46 who lives with her husband and two sons in the small village of Khagrabari in the district of Jalpaiguri. She has a primary education. One of her sons is in college, and the other is engaged in his father's business.
