For this reason she is asking for a loan from FUSAI, to invest it in the paperwork related to legalizing the ownership of her land, and by this to have an inheritance she can leave to her children.

loans.use: to pay the administrative fees to legalize the ownership of her land.

loans.name: Juana Isidra

texts.es: La señora juana es habitante de tonala municipio de chinandega es municipio en el cual la mayoria de sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura esta casada es comerciante cuenta con un negocio de venta de verduras y dulce en el mercado municipal de chinandega desde hace 21 años  la señora recibe financiamiento cada 2 meses para su negocio cabe mencionar que es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, humilde  con deseo de superacion la señora inicia un dia de trabajo desde las 5 de las mañana y finaliza a las tres de la tarde.
texts.en:
Juana lives in Tonala, a municipality of Chinandega where most of inhabitants work in agriculture.  She is married and earns a living selling vegetables and sweets at the Chinandega municipal market where she has been in business for 21 years.

Juana receives financing every two months for her business.  She is a hard worker, responsible, humble and determined to get ahead.  She begins work at 5:00 a.m. and ends at 3:00 p.m.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes, sweet pepper, garlic and cucumbers in large quantities and in boxes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy quintals of corn and beans.

loans.name: Qorilazo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina ella es soltera y tiene 35 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “QORILAZO” communal bank. This bank is located in the Cuzco district in the province and department of Cuzco. 

This member is Marcelina. She is single and 35 years old. She works in her restaurant business. She prepares different dishes such as chicken and potatoes, soups and meat saltados. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She has had this business for 10 years already and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business. She is asking for the loan to buy products to cook, such as chicken, meat and vegetables.  

The other members works selling fruit, in a food business, running a convenience store and with a restaurant business. 

She is grateful to those who are a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy products to cook, such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Solidaridad De Cachimayo Group

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD DE CACHIMAYO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia  se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gallinas y otros.

Los demás socios se dedican a la crianza de animales, tienda de abarrotes, confeccion, venta de ropa, venta de golosinas, venta de comida, venta de pollipapapas.
texts.en:
Bernardina belongs to the SOLIDARIDAD DE CACHIMAYO communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cachimayo in the province of Urubamba and department of Cuzco.

She continues with her business raising small animals such as guinea pigs, hens and more. She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments. She continues to raise her little animals and to later sell to her customers. She is a responsible and hardworking person, and this is how she gets her family ahead. 

She is asking for the loan to buy hens and more.

The other members work raising animals, running a convenience store, sewing, selling clothes, selling snacks, selling food and selling chicken and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy hens and more.

loans.name: Nancy Edelcira

texts.es:
Nancy es una señora de 55 años, vive casada hace muchos años, tienen tres hijos pero ya no viven con ellos ya que ahora tienen su propia familia; Nancy vive junto a sus esposo en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, una zona  muy comercial y con un clima agradable.
Nancy es una señora muy trabajadora, desde hace 30 años se ha dedicado a la costura, aprendió de este arte de su madre. Nancy es muy dedicada a su taller de costura en el mismo que ha implementado una boutique donde expone sus prendas, arrienda un local en una zona comercial por lo que comenta le va muy bien, incluso muchas veces necesita de alguien que le ayude a confeccionar sus prendas. 
Mientras Nancy cose su esposo se dedica a pintar fachadas de casas, labora quela lleva haciendo hace 10 años, ambos aportan con ingresos para el hogar haciendo lo que ama, trabajar.
Nancy acudió a Fundación Alternativa por una vecina que le recomendó la institución, pudo obtener un crédito y con el comprará la máquina recubridora que le hace falta, con ello brindará empleo e incrementará sus ventas haciendo más prendas de vestir; se siente agradecida y feliz con el proyecto Kiva y Fundación Alternativa ya  que hacen posible que los sueños se hagan realidad.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 55-year-old woman, she has been married for many years and has three children who no longer live with her as they already have their own families.

Nancy lives with her husband in the city of Santo Domingo, which is a very commercial area with a pleasant climate. She is a hard-working woman and has earned a living with sewing for 30 years. She learned this trade from her mother. Nancy is very committed to her workshop in which she has also set up a small boutique where she displays here clothes. She has rented a store in a commercial zone and says that it goes very well, she even needs someone who helps her sewing clothes sometimes. When Nancy is sewing, her husband works painting house fronts. He has done this for 10 years. Both contribute to the household income by doing what the love: working. 

Nancy approached Fundación Alternativa through a neighbor who recommended the institution to her. She received a loan which she will use to buy an overlock machine, because she does not have one yet. With this she will be able to provide employment and to increase her sales by making more garments.

She is thankful and happy with Kiva and Fundación Alternativa, because they make it possible to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, rods and nails to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to reinforce the walls of his house.

loans.name: Mizeituni Group

texts.fr: Bagiribwiko est commerçante et vice présidente de la banque villageoise Mizeituni, cliente de l’IMF Hekima,  mariée, âgée de 42 ans, mère de 9 enfants dont 7 scolarisés et 2 sont encore gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de sa famille. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Elle est vendeuses des denrées alimentaires depuis 14 ans. Elle va acheter des sacs d'haricots etc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Bagiribwiko is a businesswoman and vice president of the Mizeituni village group. A customer of Hekima MFI, she is 42 years old and married with 9 children - 7 of whom are in schoo,l with the other two still very young.
She started her business with money received from her family. Her husband is unemployed. She has sold food products for 14 years, and purchases bags of beans etc. 
She hopes to get more credit, to build a home, and to school and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support given to entrepreneurs unable to get traditional bank accounts.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans etc.

loans.name: Alliance Group

texts.fr: La cliente Amina est une femme ambitieuse, trésorière du collectif de crédits Alliance, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un maçon, âgée de 35 ans, mère de 4 enfants, tous  vont à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu d’un crédit d’une Institution de la place. Elle est vendeuse des boissons à domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville. Elle va s’approvisionner en 10 caisses de Primus, 5 Skol, 10 Simba, 5 Dopell etc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Amina is an ambitious women, treasurer of the Alliance credit collective. A customer of Hekima IMF she is 35 years old and married to a mason; they have 4 children, all in school. She started her business with funding received from a local credit institution.
She is a door-to-door drinks salesperson in a lively street in the city. She will buy supplies as follows: 10 cases of Primus, 5 of Skol, 10 Simba, 5 of Dopell etc. 
She would like to obtain more credit, to purchase a plot of land, and to school and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support given to entrepreneurs unable to get traditional bank accounts.

It should be noted that some ladies are holding their babies in the picture.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her drinks business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and a display case for his store.

loans.name: Miracle Group

texts.fr: Kazibwami est une femme d’affaires, membre de groupe de crédits Miracle, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un enseignant, âgée de 37 ans, mère de 8 enfants, dont 5 vont à l’école et 3 sont encore gamins. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse  des poissons au marché de la ville. Elle va s’approvisionner en pissons salés. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Kazibwami is a businesswoman and a member of the Miracle credit group. A customer of Hekima MFI, she is married to a teacher and is a 37 year old mother of 8 children, 5 of whom attend school while the other three are still very young. 
She started her business with funding from her husband. She is a fish seller in the town market. She will buy supplies of salted fish. 
She would like to obtain more credit, to purchase a plot of land, and to school and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support given to small entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

It should be noted that one lady is holding her baby in the picture.

loans.use: to buy supplies of salted fish.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support her family. Carmen is married and has a business raising chickens in the Philippines.

Carmen requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Carmen has been in this business for 2 years now.

Carmen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Conchita is 48 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Conchita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her business.

Conchita has been in this business for 11 years. Conchita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her business

loans.name: Hodari Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kabeya est une femme ambitieuse, membre du collectif de crédits Hodari, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un agent de la police, âgée de 38 ans, mère de 7 enfants, tous  vont à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son salaire. Elle est vendeuse  des boissons dans un dépôt dans une avenue animée de la ville. Elle va s’approvisionner en 30 caisses de Primus et 20 caisses  sucrées. Elle souhaite renforcer son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables de la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Kabeya is an ambitious woman, and a member of the Hodari loan group. A customer of Hekima MFI, she is married to a policeman and is a 38 year old mother of 7 children, all of whom attend school. 
She started her business with funding received from her salary. She is a drinks seller in a small shop on a lively avenue in the city. She will buy 30 cases of Primus and 20 cases of soda.
She would like to grow her business, and to school and feed her children. 
Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support given to small entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy supplies of Primus beer and sodas.

loans.name: Source Divine Group

texts.fr: Fabiola est commerçante et trésorière de la banque villageoise Source Divine, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 42 ans, mère de 7 enfants, tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Elle est vendeuses des denrées alimentaires au marché dans un dépôt depuis 10 ans. Elle va acheter la farine de maïs etc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a trader and also treasurer of the Source Divine group. A customer of Hekima MFI, she is a 42 year old widow, and mother of 7 children, all of whom are in education. She started her business with funding from her husband when he was alive.
For ten years, she has sold food and ingredients in a small shop at the market. She will buy cornflour etc. She would like to obtain more credit and to school, clothe and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support given to entrepreneurs unable to get traditional bank accounts.

loans.use: to purchase cornflour etc.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 34 years old and married with one child. As they are currently in school, Divina works very hard to provide for them.

Divina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, shampoo, detergent, bath soap and noodles to sell. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

Divina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, shampoo, detergent, bath soap and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Zhanargul

texts.ru: Жанаргул 37 лет, замужем, 2 детей, образование высшее педагогическое, уже много лет работает учителем в школе. Дополнительно с 1997 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, на сегодняшний день в своем хозяйстве Жанаргул имеет 2 коровы, 1 лошадь. Также на 0,30 ГА собственной и 1,00 ГА арендованной земли она выращивает ячмень. Жанаргул знает технологию ведения сельскохозяйственной деятельности и умеет вкладывать средства по назначению. Ее ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жанаргул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели. Жанаргул намерена увеличить поголовье скота, а доходы от кредита позволят ей накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Zhanargul is 37 years old, married, and has two children.  She has a degree in teaching and has been a school teacher for many years.  Since 1997, she has earned an additional income in animal husbandry and farming.  Zhanargul now has two cows and a horse.  She owns 0.3 ha of land and rents another 1.0 ha where she grows barley.   Zhanargul knows how to run an agricultural business and is skilled at using her resources as needed.  Her total monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further developing her business, Zhanargul applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy a heifer.  Zhanargul intends to increase the size of her herd of cattle and the profits from the loan will allow her to save up the money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a heifer in order to earn a large profit and repair her house

loans.name: Nabouy Group

texts.en:
Lone's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water. The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.

Lone is excited that she, like her neighbors, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter. This is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. 

The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nakham Group

texts.en:
Buakhai's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water. The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.  

Buakhai is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter. This is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. 

The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Pongkeu Group

texts.en:
Deexai's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water. The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. 

Deexai is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter. This is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. 

The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 65 years old, married, and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. Gloria operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She earns additional income from fishing.

Gloria requested her tenth loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more items to sell in her general store. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin loves working with numbers. “Accounting has been a passion of mine since I took my first class in high school,” he says. 

Kevin has over 20 years of experience working in bookkeeping, taxes and payroll. At the beginning of his career, he worked for other people, but he was laid off during the recession. 
 
“I started this business after being laid off from corporate America in 2006. I started taking on part-time assignments. The list of clients grew and the rest is history,”  he says. 

Kevin founded KCAA Global in 2009, a personalized accounting firm that serves Hackensack, New Jersey. KCAA has two other employees, and up until recently, Kevin’s wife was also working with him in the office. Unfortunate circumstances have prevented her from doing so. 

“My wife recently had brain surgery. Now I am the sole provider for my wife and son,” he says. Kevin also helps out his father and brother, a situation which has put a strain on his business and finances.  

Despite these challenges, Kevin’s business has continued to grow, and KCAA now has an office in Hackensack. Recently, he’s also been recognized for his work. “A client I worked for had an employee who was embezzling funds and I was the whistleblower. We got him indicted,” he says, an effort that landed Kevin in the local newspapers. 

While proud of his many achievements, Kevin still faces the financial hardships common to many business owners. “Collections has been my biggest difficulty; there’s always a client who’s late with payments,” he says.

Kevin is requesting a loan to help KCAA keep afloat during this difficult time. “The purpose of this loan is for new accounting software, office furniture and general working capital,” he says.   

Let’s see Kevin through and help KCAA stay in business.

loans.use: to purchase accounting software and furniture and have working capital.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Fe is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Fe has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Fe has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Josephine is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Melly

texts.en:
Ma. Melly is 53 years old and married with six children. With one child still in school, Ma. Melly works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Melly runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12 000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like cereal, seasonings, cooking oil, sanitary pads, hair conditioners, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Ma. Melly has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as cereal, seasonings, cooking oil, sanitary pads, hair conditioners, detergent soap, etc. 

Ma. Melly would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like cereal, seasonings, cooking oil, sanitary pads, hair conditioners, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel works hard to support her family. Maridel is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Maridel requested a PHP 11 000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maridel has been in this business for two years now.

Maridel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. Rebecca is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rebecca has requested a PHP 12 000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rebecca has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rufo

texts.en:
Rufo signed up for his membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a store business. He is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like him. 

Rufo was able to turn the tide in his favor and is making good sales these days. He wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, he took a loan to restock his store with 30 bags of rice to sell. 

In the future, he hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock his store with 30 bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been in this business for 5 years now.

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 32 years old and married with five children. With four children currently in school, Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosita has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as cereals, shampoo, candies, noodles, canned goods, soft-drinks, fabric conditioners, etc. 

In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married and has six children. She lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman who never gets tired of supporting their big family.

Flora requested a loan from Paglaum MPC for 50,000.00 PHP, which she will use to buy needed materials for fishing. She makes use of teared foam in their fish vending and hopes to buy new ones. Flora also wants to buy another unit of a fishing boat for a more catch. Through this project, she hopes to earn more income and be of help for the expansion of their business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 3D printer and invest in a marketing strategy.

loans.name: Rodulio

texts.es: Rodulio, tiene 32 años de edad, está casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Taulabe.   Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Hace 10 años que cultiva café y también miel de abeja.  El café y la miel la venden en la misma zona o mercado local. Ha invertido varios prestamos para mantener activas sus actividades, actualmente solicita otro préstamo por 6,000 lempiras para comprar  abono y limpieza de la finca con el fin de poder incrementar  la producción de café. Su plan es seguir dándole mantenimiento a su finca y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Rodulio is 32 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He lives with his family in a village in the municipality of Taulabe. He has always worked in agriculture. For 10 years he has been cultivating coffee and also bee honey. He sells the coffee and the honey in this same area or at the local market. He has invested many loans to keep his activities alive. Currently, he is requesting another loan of 6,000 lempiras to buy manure and to clean the farm so that he can increase coffee production. His plan is continue maintaining his farm and educating his children.

loans.use: to buy manure and to clean the coffee farm.

loans.name: Dev

texts.en:
Dev came up with the idea for Gprotect, a home-based full-service computer repair company, while studying business at NYU. Following a  two-year hiatus in which he went back to his native India, Dev decided to resuscitate Gprotect. 

Gprotect is unlike other run-of-the-mill computer repair shops. It operates remotely, sparing clients the hassle of transporting their computers to a shop.  

Some of the services Gprotect offers include virus and spyware removal, data backup, software installations, and Internet network assistance. He currently employs two people and is hopeful for the future of his business.  

“I think that my business idea has a large potential for growth and scale. I want to provide my services all over the world,” he says.

The biggest challenge for Gprotect, ironically, is also its biggest strength. “Getting my website off the ground has been my  greatest challenge,” he says. The creation and maintenance of an efficient online transaction system is expensive and requires a lot of work.   

Dev needs this loan to upgrade the E-commerce shopping cart feature for his website, as well as invest in a marketing strategy.  

With a great idea and enthusiastic attitude, Dev is sure to take Gprotect to new heights. Help him get there quickly.

loans.use: to pay for a website update with e-commerce functionality.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony, 33, is married with three adult-age children. His major source of income is buying and selling grocery items.  The business has helped to meet his family's financial needs, especially the education of his children until they graduated and got jobs. He is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to his loyal customers. Someday, he will have a legacy to leave to his children. 

His plan is to maintain his inventory so that his customers will be served well. He is still planning for business expansion for the good of his children. He already accessed loans previously to purchase additional stock and now he is re-applying for a loan for his store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for his grocery store.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a businesswoman from Nonoc, Larena, Siquijor. She is 44 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Ann is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic goods and consumable items. Ann continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic goods and consumable items

loans.name: Jessyl

texts.en:
Jessyl is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 38,  married in Cangbagsa, Larena, Siquijor, she runs a store that primarily supports their family. Every day she never gets tired tending her store. 

Jessyl is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously repaid her obligations without records of default. Now, she has borrowed another loan to pay for stocks of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for stocks of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Galecia

texts.en:
Galecia, 47 years old, lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Ocidental, Philippines. She is married and gifted with four children. Her husband is a farmer who plants rice, corn and other crops. Their main source of income is from farming using their own Carabao (water buffalo). Galecia has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself helping her husband plow the rice field and plant corn and other crops. 

In need of additional working capital, Galecia decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 10,000 for buying farm inputs, fertilizer and paying labor costs for cultivating their land.

Galecia has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to access the needed working capital. She hopes to own a farm tractor someday to use for land cultivation.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Joe- Ann

texts.en: Joe-Ann has signed up for membership with PMPC to gain the capital she needs to start up a sari-sari (general) store business. She is thankful for the capital PMPC extends to small-scale borrowers like her. Joe-Ann has been able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to create a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Forty-six-year-old Geraldine is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. Recently, she took a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase bags of animal feed and vitamins. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, Geraldine thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed and vitamins

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, a hardworking mother, requests a loan of PHP 7,000 from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of bananas for resale. This way, she will be able to sell bananas at wholesale which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of bananas for resale

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan de 32 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 1 mes, 5 años y 8 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida como jornalero, en una finca cercana a su vivienda, además su esposa le apoya con la economía familiar por medio de su pequeño negocio de venta de antojitos típicos. Juan desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que las láminas están deterioradas y ha necesitado colocar plástico sobre ellas para que no se filtre el agua, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Juan, 32, lives in his own house with his wife and his three children, 1 month, 5, and 8.

He's a hardworking man who earns a living as a day laborer on a farm near his house.  Also, his wife helps him with the family budget with her small business selling traditional snacks.

Juan wants to change the roof on his house because the metal sheets are damaged and he has had to put plastic over them so the water doesn't get in.  As a result he's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to change the roof of his house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to change the roof of his house

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 61 years old and married with ten children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Violeta has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for nine years.

Violeta requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could access financial assistance for her chosen business. Maria  has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she accessed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Maria wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Virginia has been in this business for six years now.

Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 25 years old and single.  She is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Angeline requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angeline has been doing pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 49 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Violeta works very hard to provide for her family.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 27 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jose Ignacio

texts.es: José tiene 44 años de edad y habita junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 17 años y 16 años de edad en vivienda propia. José se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de albañilería y de seguridad, lo cual le permite llevar el  sustento a su hogar y dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. José desea ampliar la galera de la cocina y reparar el techo que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera, polines, clavos, etc.
texts.en:
José, 44, lives in his own house with his spouse and his two children, ages 17 and 16.  José earns a living offering his services in construction and security, which allows him to support his household and give his family better living conditions.

José wants to expand the galley of his kitchen and repair the roof, which is currently in bad condition.  As a result he's asking FUSAI for this loan to invest in buying galvanized metal sheets, wood, beams, nails, and other materials.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, beams, nails, and other materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase office equipment and supplies, as well as obtain a notary license

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for fixing motorcycles

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business  raising pigs in the Philippines.

Bernarda requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 16 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Bernarda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Belemnaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme TALATO est responsable du groupe BELEMNAABA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. Les 04 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend des légumes et des céréales  depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Elle veut s’acheter 20sacs de choux, 10sacs d’oignons et 05sacs de mil.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son commerce et aider à scolariser ses enfants. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin de stockage.
texts.en:
Mrs. TALATO is the head of the BELEMNAABA group. She is married with four children aged 12 to 27 who all go to school. 

Talato has been selling vegetables and cereals for 10 years. She buys her stock at local markets. She plans to buy 20 bags of cabbage, 10 bags of onions, and 5 bags of millet.  

She will use her profits to bolster her business and to support her children’s education. Her goal is to open a large storage facility.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of cabbage, 10 bags of onions, and 5 bags of millet.

loans.name: Mayra Damaris

texts.es:
La señora Mayra es habitante de chinandega es casada tiene 3 hijos dos en edad escolar cuenta con un negocio de venta de carne de cerdo, frito ,pepena, charrasca y manteca de cerdo ubicado en el mercado municipal de chinandega desde hace 8 años  es una mujer responsable ,trabajadora, humilde con deseo de superacion.

la señora solicita financiamiento para la compra de cerdo para ella destasarlo y obtener mas ganacias y sacar mas mercaderia.
texts.en: Mayra lives in Chinandega. She is married and has 3 school age children. For 8 years she has had the business of selling pork, fried pork, cooked pork fat, charrasca and pork lard at the Municipal market of Chinandega. She is a responsible, hardworking and humble woman with a wish to move ahead in life. Mayra is requesting a loan to buy pork for carving so she can obtain more earnings and get more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy four live pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy staples for his business

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is the definition of a multitasking entrepreneur. At his office in the Bronx, Franklin offers a myriad of services including taxes, immigration and more recently, real estate. This versatility is unsurprising, as Franklin comes from a family of business folk. “My father owned a business when he was alive and I grew up in that kind of environment,” he says. 

Four years ago while working with his sister, also an entrepreneur, is when he realized that he was better off working independently. “[In] February 2011, I opened my business and I don’t regret it.”

Franklin arrived in the United States 25 years ago from the Dominican Republic. Many of his clients are also immigrants. “I came to the USA when I was 12 years old. I speak Spanish very well; that’s how I can help most of my clientele that doesn’t speak English.”

Now this ambitious husband and father of two is seeking extra working capital to invest in his business. “I bought a website domain, but haven’t had the time to develop it,” he says.  

Franklin needs this loan to finish the webpage, make flyers and business cards, purchase more printers and a desk, as well as a projector for the office’s window. Visibility for the office is a long-term concern for him.  

As his business continue to expand and attract customers, Franklin envisions hiring year-round staff and opening more offices around New York. This loan represents Franklin’s opportunity for growth. Help him make his vision come true.

loans.use: to pay for a website, marketing materials and office equipment

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 36 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Crisanta has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. Crisanta requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Crisanta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elenfe

texts.en:
Elenfe is 20 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Elenfe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, etc. to sell. Elenfe has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, etc.

Elenfe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Alianca

texts.en: Alianca is requesting a loan to buy additional supplies to  keep in her store, including coffee, sugar, rice, cooking oil, tomato sauce, aqua, tea, scoop, and other things to sell, including soft drinks. She has been doing business since 2014 with her own working capital of $1,000.00. She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is requesting a loan of 800 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital to buy more goods to keep in her kiosk. She is happy when she takes a loan because she can have good management for her business. She is (also) cultivating animals like cows, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, rice, cooking oil, tomato sauce, aqua, tea, scoop, and other things to sell, including soft drinks.

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Voeurn, 53, is an experienced and active farmer. At home, she is a lovely mother of one dependent child and she also has another five married children. By operating a rice farming business on a small farm, Voeurn can earn around 2.50 USD a day to support her family's daily expenses. So far, she has been involved in this career for around 30 years.

To keep her rice growing well with more productivity, Voeurn is going to use natural fertilizers on her farmland. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan via KHL to buy fertilizers to use in her farming process this farming season. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it can make her rice grow better and produce more crops. She thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 37 and is married with two children. He manages their own farm to make a living. He raises pigs and sells them in town, earning well for the family. With his income, Allan was able to make some improvements to his business. 

Recently, Allan took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase feeding supplies and additional piglets to raise. He wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family through his swine-fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Clemencia Maria

texts.es:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados es una ciudad de la región costa conocida en el país por ser una zona muy productiva y comercial. Justamente en este punto existe mucho intercambio comercial por ser el puerto terrestre que une la sierra y la costa. Aquí vive Clemencia, una señora de 56 años, separada, viven con una hija, su nieta y con una hermana.
Clemencia a pesar de no tener un esposo a lado ella ha salido adelante sola, ha trabajado mucho por darles la educación a sus hijas, trabaja todos los días vendiendo ropa interior, recorre por su sector hace dos años, ahora ya tiene clientela fija. Además de este ingreso, cuenta con un local de arriendo que logró construir gracias a su trabajo.
Clemencia es una clienta fiel a la institución, hace un año atrás acudió a ella por la oportunidad que brindan al ayudar al microempresario a través de créditos; ahora es su segundo crédito, con el podrá comprar más mercadería y vender a mejor precio. 
Agradece a todos quienes forman Fundación Alternativa y en especial a Kiva porque con los créditos entregados ayudan a muchas personas que necesitan prosperar en sus pequeñas empresas.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo de los Colorados is a city in the coastal region.  It is known in the country for being a very productive and commercial area.  This is precisely where there is a lot of commercial exchange because it is the inland port that joins the mountains with the coast.  

This is where Clemencia, age 56, lives.  She is separated, and she lives with a daughter, her granddaughter, and a sister.  In spite of not having a husband by her side, Clemencia has gotten ahead by herself.  She has worked a lot to give her daughters an education.  She works selling underwear every day.  She has been doing this for two years by traveling through her sector .  She now has fixed customers.  In addition to this income, she has a place she rents out, which she managed to build thanks to her work.

Clemencia is a loyal client of the institution.  A year ago she came to the institution because of the opportunity they provide to help small business people through the loans.  This is now her second loan.  With the loan she will be able to buy more merchandise and sell at a better price.

She is grateful to everyone who is a part of the Fundación Alternativa.  She is especially grateful to Kiva because the loans help a lot of people who need to prosper in their small businesses.

loans.use: to stock her business with merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase construction material for his home.

loans.name: Tuimizane Group

texts.fr: Nyangoma est commerçante et membre du groupe de crédits Tuimizane, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un cambiste, responsable et mère de plusiers enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans le marché secondaire de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va acheter 50 paires de souliers. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, acheter une parcelle et scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Nyangoma, a merchant, is a member of the group Tuimizane and a client of the Hekima MFI. She is married to a money trader, and she is a mother to several dependent children who all go to school. 

She has been selling used shoes in the city’s secondary market for 5 years. She started her activity with funds given to her by her husband. She plans to buy 50 pairs of shoes. 

Her goals are to bolster her activity, to buy some land and to support her children’s education. 

She wishes to thank Hekima for helping entrepreneurs who do not have access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy 50 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en:
Evangelista is 63 years old and married with one child.  She is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

She has been buying and selling livestock for five years now, and has borrowed nine times from NWTF in the past to sustain it. Evangelista would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 39 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as canned goods, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, milk, juice, etc. to sell.

Irene has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Irene aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as canned goods, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, milk, juice, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janeth is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.
She has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store. Janeth has been in this business for two years. In the future, Janeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Beneranda

texts.en: Beneranda has been involved in business activities since 2013; she started with her own working capital of $175.00. She has a kiosk in her house and she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to open a big store in the future. So she is taking a loan of $600.00 that she will use to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including candles, soaps, water, milk, salt, sardines, cooking oils, biscuits, noodles, sweets, rice, soft drinks and other things to sell. She hopes with the loan that she is offered from Tuba Rai Metin, she can reach her expectations in the future. She also has animals such as pigs and chickens.

loans.use: To buy candles, soaps, water, milk, salts, sardines, cooking oils, biscuits, noodles, sweets, rice, soft drinks and other things to sell  in her general store.

loans.name: Maria Araceli

texts.es: María tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 12 años, 8 años, y 4 años de edad. María se gana la vida por medio de la venta de variedad de prendas de vestir y lociones. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante  desde hace 10 años. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la cocina el cual se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y pines.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and lives in her own house together with her life partner and their 3 children - 12, 8, and 4 years old.  Maria makes a living by selling a variety of clothing and lotions. Her business is itinerant, moving from place to place for the last 10 years.  

Maria asks for this loan to invest in the repair of the roof of her kitchen which has deteriorated.  With the money she is asking for she will buy galvanized sheets, wood, nails and pins.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, nails, and pins to repair the roof of the kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, wood and nails to repair a room.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is married and has five children. She works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. 

Elvira requested her eighteenth loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more fish to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Patima

texts.ru: Патима, 55 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У Патимы среднее образование, на протяжении 35 лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством. У Патимы в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и 3 теленка, также на земельном наделе 1,20 ГА арендованной и 1,20 ГА собственной земли, Патима выращивает перец, клевер и фасоль. Патима очень принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. Она счастливая супруга, мама и бабушка. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Патима обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 бычка. Доходы от кредита Патима планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена в будущем купить трактор.
texts.en: Patima is 55 years old, married, and has three children. Patima has a secondary education. For the last 35 years, she has been practicing cattle breeding and crop farming. Patima has 2 cows and 3 calves on her farm, as well as a 1.20 hectare plot of rented land and a 1.20 hectare plot of her own land on which she grows peppers, clover and beans. Patima is a very principled, honest, respectable and tough person. She is a contented wife, mother and grandmother. For the further development of her farm, Patima turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 30,000 som (KGS) to buy one bull calf. Patima plans to use the earnings from the loan for the development of her farm. She is also determined to buy a tractor in the future.

loans.use: to purchase one bull calf.

loans.name: Tuimizane B Group

texts.fr: Kondokelwa est une femme d’affaires et membre du groupe de crédits Tuimizane B, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un pasteur, mère dynamique avec plusieurs enfants et tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans le marché secondaire de la ville depuis 16 ans. Elle va acheter 100 paires de souliers. Elle souhaite renforcer son capital, acheter une parcelle, la construire et scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kondokelwa, a businesswoman, is a member of the group Tuimizane B and a client of the Hekima MFI. Her husband is a pastor, and she is a dynamic mother to several children who have all received schooling. 

She has been selling used shoes in the city’s secondary market for 16 years. She started her activity with funds given to her by her husband. She plans to buy 100 pairs of shoes. 

Her goals are to bolster her activity, to buy some land and build some property, and to support her children’s education. 

She wishes to thank Hekima for helping entrepreneurs who do not have access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy 100 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida owns and operates a food stall, which she has been doing for 10 years. She finds ways to improve her income and to provide for her family's everyday needs.

Zenaida requested another new loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings, in larger quantities. She hopes to expand her business and dreams of better life and good health for her family. 

Zenaida meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Carmen Dolores

texts.es:
Carmen Dolores es una señora de 59 años, vive junto a sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los  Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa.
Hace 13 años el esposo de Carmen emigró al extranjero y nunca más volvió, desde ese entonces Carmen tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos, comenzó a vender ropa a vecinas, luego fue incrementando su negocio poco a poco, ahora también vende cosméticos. Carmen es una señora muy trabajadora que incluso ha asistido a cursos de cocina que dan en el municipio de la ciudad y gracias a ello aprendió mucho y también en eventos especiales brinda sus servicios de preparar comida. 
Carmen conoció a Fundación Alternativa hace tres años quien recibió un crédito en grupo, ahora Carmen solicitó un crédito individual el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos, de ropa y de una vitrina para exponer sus productos. El sueño de Carmen es en un futuro no muy lejano ponerse su propio local, para vender su mercadería y las manualidades que suele hacer en sus tiempos libres. Se siente muy agradecida porque la institución le ha ayudado a crecer y a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen Dolores is a 59 year old woman who lives with her two children in the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city in the coastal region with an agreeable climate. It is a very commercial city and it is considered as a land port that links the mountains and the coast. Thirteen years ago Carmen's husband emigrated abroad and never returned. Since then Carmen has had to raise her children. She started selling clothing to neighbors and then expanded her business little by little. Now she also sells cosmetics. Carmen is a very hard-working woman who has also attended cooking classes that they have at City Hall and thanks to this she has learned a lot. She provides her services preparing food at special events.

Carmen learned about Fundación Alternativa three years ago when she received a loan as part of a group. Now Carmen is requesting an individual loan which she will invest in buying cosmetics, clothing and a display window to exhibit her products. Carmen's dream for the not too distant future is to open her own shop to sell her merchandise and handicrafts that she makes in her spare time. She feels very grateful to the institution as it has helped her grow and improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing and a display cabinet to exhibit her cosmetics.

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en:
Natalina is 37 years old; she is a business woman. She has a kiosk in her house and she also brings item to sell in the market. She has been involved in business activities since 2012, which she started with her own working capital of $500. 

She is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her kiosk in the future. She is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy needed items to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, salts, pop noodles (instant noodles), candles, cooking oils, noodles, rice, and other things to sell. 

She is happy that she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because with the loan that is offered to her, she wants used to improve her business and she wants to get a good management for her business. Natalina also cultivate animals in her house like cows, pigs, and chickens.

loans.use: to buy slippers, candles, cooking oils, noodles, rice, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Yong

texts.en:
Yong is 65 years old and has six children. She lives in Kampong Chnang province where she sells grocery items as the main source of her family income. Her husband grows rice to earn extra income. 

Yong requested her eighth loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her family can have electricity to use and  update their lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon is a 34-year-old mother of two schoolchildren, who is living in Kampong Chang province. 

To support the family's living condition, she grows rice on a three hectare area. Moreover, she can earn extra income via raising pigs. 

For Mon, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her house will have electricity to use and her family can live in better conditions than before.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: A farmer in Kompong Chhang province, Sophy is 40 years old and a mother of one child in school. She struggles to earn a living by farming rice and raising pigs. Her husband works as a construction worker to earn more income. This is Sophy's eighth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans. She wisely used the additional income from the loans to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace. She will spend her loan portion to buy solar panels. She hopes that her house has electricity to use and that she can update her living conditions to be better than before.

loans.use: To buy solar panels.

loans.name: Panha

texts.en:
Panha, 51, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has struggled to feed and care for her children by farming rice and cassava for 30 years. The current business earns her about 14 USD per day.
 
Panha is just with VisionFund for this cycle and is applying for a loan to pay her daughter’s tuition to study Accounting. She hopes this loan will enable her daughter to have a good job after her graduation.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition to study Accounting

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: A mother of two children, Horn is 48 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang province. To support her family, she sells grocery items as her source of income. She also grows rice to supplement her income. For Horn, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions and health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Ngor's Group

texts.en:
A resident who lives in Siem Reap province, Ngor is 50 years old and a mother of four children, one of whom is in school. 

For her living, she grows rice on one-and-a-half hectares of land and raises pigs to earn extra income. She has worked in this business for ages and she earns about 19,400 KHR per day. 

For Ngo, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is a leader of the group of three and she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can increase her family's good health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sandro Stefano

texts.es:
Sandro es un joven soltero y entusiasta de 18 años que trabaja como DJ en un Karaoke de su ciudad natal, Ica. También está estudiando una profesión en un Instituto. Sandro sabe que trabajar y estudiar es un gran desafío, pero él lo asume con muchas ganas porque quiere convertirse en una gran profesional y ofrecer más oportunidades a su familia.
Sandro está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un nuevo equipo de DJ para que pueda brindar un mejor servicio y así sus ingresos mejoren. Con esto seguirá esforzándose por su familia para que pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y sacarlos adelante.
texts.en: Sandro is a single enthusiastic 18 year old who works as a DJ in a karaoke  in his native city, Ica. He is also studying a profession at an Institute. Sandro knows that working and studying is a big challenge but he takes it on with much desire as he wants to become a great professional and offer more opportunities to his family. Sandro is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their support he can buy new DJ equipment so that he can offer better service and improve his income. He will continue to exert himself for his family to improve their quality of living and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy DJ equipment for his work.

loans.name: Hak's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Siem Reap province, Hak is 41 years old and a mother of three children, one of whom is very young. She earns income to improve her family's condition via rice cropping on two hectares of land and raising pigs to earn more income. 

This is the first time for Hak with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As a group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can increase her family's good health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is one of the management science students studying Commerce and Harbor Administration in the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He wants to be a reliable and professional employee in a large harbor office. 

Ronald comes from the interior of the island of Ambon, in Maluku. The parents of Ronald live only as sellers of yellow rice. His parents tried to make every effort to help Ronald achieve his goals. The economic conditions of his parents are currently uncertain because now the prices of goods are more expensive. 

Ronald is determined to continue his studies. He is hoping to get a loan from Kiva, to help finance his studies and ease the burden of his parents. 

Ronald is very grateful to the lender because he can continue his studies, although they are not personally known to one another.

loans.use: to pay his education fees.

loans.name: Davina

texts.en:
This is Divina, 54, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Angelico, a farmer, and they have eleven children. Together, they manage their household while operating the business. They both work hard to continually provide income for their everyday living expenses and to send their children to school.

Divina operates a pineapple farm and has been in the business for ten years. She grows pineapple on their farm located in Cavite. Their farm is in the highlands where it is suited to grow pineapple and other fruits. She sells her product to the market and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,250 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her farm, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She is positive her sales and earnings will increase. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Divina aims to grow her farm so she can give her children the best education possible. She faithfully meets weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farm supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Vath

texts.en:
Vath, who is a 54-year-old woman, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two unmarried children and five married children. 

To make a living and support her family, she has been involved with a rice farming business on a small farmland since 1980. The average income that she makes is USD 2.50 per day.For supplementary income, she has raised many ducklings at her house to re-sell them when they are big enough. Now she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy duck food to feed all the ducklings. 

With the support from this loan, she hopes that it will help to improve her living standard. She would like to thank for all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy food for her ducks

loans.name: Diane Claire

texts.en:
Diane Claire is 18 years old  and a third-year college student who wants to become an engineer. The primary hindrance to her studies is financial needs because her parents' income is not enough for all the expenses. 

Diane Claire requested a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to pay tuition fees. She wants to finish her studies to help her parents. She will pay back her loan in full with the help of her supportive parents.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a 47-year-old married woman, and the mother of three children, from Baybay, Leyte. She has been engaged in timber/lumber sales with her husband for more than 6 years now. This business is the source of their income.

Esmeralda is asking for a loan to buy more wood or lumber. With this purchase, she will be able to improve her stocks, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. Esmeralda believes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business and augment her income. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more wood or lumber

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kompong Speu province, Sarat is 45 years old and a mother of seven children. 

She secures the basic needs of her family via rice cropping on one hectare of land. She has worked in this business for ages and earns about 20,000 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four to get new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that having a latrine in her house will improve the health of her family.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 18 years old and lives in Alcala with her parents. Jenny is a second-year college student studying Elementary Education. She wants to become a teacher someday.

To help achieve her dreams, she needs an educational loan of PHP 10,000 to pay her tuition fees and school allowances. She hopes to finish her degree so that she can acquire a good-paying job someday to help lift her family out of poverty. She is very positive that Kiva lenders will grant her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee and allowance at school

loans.name: Savoeun's Group

texts.en:
Savoeun is 45 years old and has one child who attends university. She is a local rice farmer from Kampong Speu province. She earns about 18,000 KHR per day. 

Savoeun is the leader of her group, which consists of four members. She requested her first loan from VisionFund, which she will use to build a latrine. She hopes that the latrine will help her family be healthy.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Narlina

texts.en:
Narlina has been operating her own retail store selling household products for three years. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She and her husband work hard, with the determination of earning a better income to provide their children with a better education.

Narlina is requesting a another loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional supplies and merchandise to sell, including more quantities of dust pans, mirrors, hangers, pliers, and other products needed in her business. In the future, Narlina desires to open another branch of her business. She dreams for her children to complete their studies. 

Narlina meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies such as a dust pan, mirror, hanger, pliers, and other products needed for her business.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a widower who lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She continues to maintain and manage the small fish pond left by her late husband. The pond of milkfish brings Pacita an income. 

Recently, Pacita borrowed an amount of Php10,000 from Paglaum MPC to purchase milkfish fingerlings. As the milkfish are harvested in due time, Pacita thinks positively of a bigger income, since she already has customers to buy them. 

Pacita always lends a hand in taking care of her grandchildren and will be very happy seeing them having a decent and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase milkfish fingerlings

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo a su cargo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú; donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Este distrito es habitado por personas muy amables y respetuosas.

Consuelo se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Consuelo piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
