Consuelo is 53 years old, is married, has a son to take care of, and lives with her family in a rural area of the district of Oyutun, province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, in the north coast of Peru. The population of this district works in agriculture, cattle raising and commerce. The district is inhabited by very pleasant and respectful people. 

Consuelo works raising and trading with animals. She has more than 10 years of experience in this business, which is located in the back of her home. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals. This investment will allow her to have more varied and productive animals, and more influence in the business. Consuelo wants to increase her animal stock to be able to cater to the different tastes and needs of the customers in the region.

loans.use: to purchase more animals, which will allow her to have more varied and productive animals.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is divorced with 1 child. She is 51 years old and lives in Señor Sinacaban, Philippines.

Andresa sells a variety of products from her store to earn a living, and she has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to restock her store with basic commodities. She has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. 

In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Ney's Group

texts.en:
Ney, 44, is a farmer living in Kampong Speu Province and a mother of three children. 

To support her family's living condition, she grows rice as her single source of income. She can earn about 20,000 KHR per day from the business that she has had for ages. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is a leader group of two and she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is a 44-year-old married woman. She has three dependent children and one married child. She lives in a small village of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling her crops to the local dealers. She has been in this career for around thirty years with an average income of USD 2 a day.

Chan wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore she is taking out a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members to gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to look after the environment. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Maria Milena

texts.es: María de 30 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijas de 5 y 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como empleada de una empresa, además su compañero de vida aporta a la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo. María está cumpliendo su sueño de tener una casa segura, ya que actualmente vive en casa de lamina, pero como podemos observar en la fotografía, María está construyendo una casa de ladrillo, pero le falta el techo, las ventanas y una puerta, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina, polines, pines, ventanas y una puerta de hierro para poder terminar de construir su vivienda y brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, 30 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and their two daughters, ages  5 and 10.  She is an enterprising woman who works hard as an employee for a company.  Her life companion also supports the family budget through his work.

Maria is fulfilling her dream of having a secure house.  She currently lives in a house made of metal sheeting, but as one can see in the photograph, Maria is building a brick house.  However,  the house lacks a roof, windows and a door.  This is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI:  to buy metal sheeting, poles, lumber, windows and a metal door to be able to finish building their home and offer more security to her family.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, poles, lumber, windows and a metal door to finish building her home

loans.name: Raul Ernesto

texts.es: Raúl de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijas de 14 y 4 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se desempeña como vendedor ambulante de diversos productos de consumo diario como: detergente, jabón, cloro, papel higiénico, champú, desinfectante, etc. Lo que le permite mantener la economía de su hogar. Raúl desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda e instalar energía eléctrica en la misma, pero al no contar con los recursos económicos necesarios, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos, interruptores, tubos y alambres para cambiar el techo e instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en: Raul is 43 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their two daughters (14 and 4 years old). He is a hardworking man that works as a street vendor of various consumer goods such as detergent, soap, chlorine, toilet paper, shampoo, disinfectant, etc. This job allows him to cover his household expenses. Raul wishes to replace the roof and install electricity in his home, but as he does not have the necessary financial resources, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheets, wood, nails, switches, pipes and wire.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheets, wood, nails, switches, pipes and wire to replace the roof and install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in materials to build a retaining wall on his property.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 39 years old and is married. 

From her desire to help her husband in raising their family, Lina thought of engaging in shell crafts. She had the idea and the skills to make lei/garlands to sell. She makes them in her house, out of shells. She started the business with a capital of 2,000 PHP. 

With the idea of expanding her inventory, she applied for a loan from Paglaum MPC. It will be used to purchase additional inventory for her shell craft business. Lina wants to sell her stock, wholesale, in nearby municipalities. 

She deeply wishes to make her dreams fulfilled out of her income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her shell craft business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married with 2 children of school age. 

She has been a PMPC member for 1 year and 5 months, and took out a loan for the necessary capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Angelina has been able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales recently. She wants to take further advantage of her good fortune, and so she has requested this loan to restock her store with basic commodities. 

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Angeli

texts.en:
Angeli owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for ten years and she repaid her previous loan, used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income through her bakery shop.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 50,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with thankfulness in her heart.

Angeli still desires to have her own house and she also hopes to give her children the best education. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Asomat

texts.ru:
Эту мудрую, деятельную, ответственную женщину зовут Асомат. Она родом из района Рудаки. Ей 52 года. Асомат занимается профессией швеи. Эта деятельность ей передана от матери. Асомат у себя дома предоставляет услуги швеи на протяжении 5 лет. Она берет заказ на пошив женских национальных платьев, и с заказами ей помогают ее ученицы. 
Асомат замужем. У нее двое сыновей в возрасте 19 и 23 года. Оба ее сыновей являются студентами. Сейчас Асомат обратилась за кредитом для ремонта дома. Она начала ремонт в доме и поскольку ей не хватает еще немного финансов, она не может завершить ремонт. Асомат очень хочет улучшить жилищные условия, а также создать комфорнтые условия для своих клиентов. Без суммы кредита ей не завершить ремонт. Поддержите ее.
texts.en:
This is Asomat, a wise, hardworking and responsible lady from the Rudaki region of Tajikistan.  She is 52, married, and has two sons ages 19 and 23, both of whom are students.  Asomat herself works as a seamstress, a trade she learned from her mother.  She works out of home, and has done so for the past 5 years, sewing Tajikistani dresses to order with the help of her apprentice.  

Asomat is seeking a loan to renovate her home; she started renovating it earlier, but had to stop due to a lack of money.  She wants to improve her family's living conditions, and make her house comfortable for her clientele.  She won't be able to finish work on her home without a loan, and is asking for your help.

loans.use: improve her family's living conditions by renovating her home

loans.name: Chheb's Group

texts.en:
Chheb, a local resident from Siem Reap province, is 36 years old and the mother of two schoolchildren. Nowadays she earns income to support her family via rice cropping on a three-hectare area. Moreover, she earns extra income to provide for her family’s needs by raising pigs, chickens and cows. She has been occupied in this business for several years and it earns her about 20,600 KHR per day.

This is Chheb's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four, she is a group leader, and she will spend this loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's access to healthy living conditions.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Gladys Odilia

texts.es:
Gladys es una madre de familia muy dedicada a sus hijos, es viuda y vive en Chincha junto a su familia. tras la pérdida de su amado esposo tuvo que tomar las riendas del negocio, es por ello que ahora está dedicada al alquiler de un carro que con mucho esfuerzo junto a su esposo pudieron adquirir, ella cree que le está yendo bien en el negocio porque siempre se esfuerza, es muy trabajadora y a pesar de todo siempre enfrenta los problemas con una gran sonrisa.
Gladys está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar el arreglo y mantenimiento de su carro para poder seguir teniendo ingresos con el alquiler, así continuará luchando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys is a mother who's very devoted to her children.  She's a widow who lives in Chincha with her family.

Following the loss of her beloved husband, she had to take charge of the business.  That's why she currently makes a living renting a car that she and her husband managed to acquire with a lot of effort.  She believes it's going well for her in the business because she always works hard.  She's very hardworking and, in spite of everything, always confronts her problems with a big smile.

Gladys is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she'll be able to fix and maintain her vehicle and keep on earning income from the rent.  That way she'll keep on striving for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to fix and maintain her minvan

loans.name: Samdei's Group

texts.en:
Samdei, 25, lives with family members in a rural village of the Siem Reap Province. She has two children, one of whom goes to school whilst the other is too young. 

She provides for the basic needs of her family via rice cropping on three hectares of land, and pig-raising. She can earn an income of about 27,900 KHR per day. 

This is Samdei's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group of two to get this loan, and will spend her portion on building a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions and keep them in good health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
In the year 2010, Romeo learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Dolipos, Oroquieta, he tried his luck and borrowed some money to jump start his rice production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Romeo feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business. 

Recently he has taken out a new loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season.

In the future he wishes to sustain his business and to be able to supply rice to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Hon's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Kampong Chhnang province, Hon is 44 years old. She is the mother of five children, three of whom are in school. To support the family, she earns money through rice growing and by climbing the palm tree.

This is Hon's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three members, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that when her house has electricity to use, she will be able to save the money she would otherwise spend on batteries.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Jairo Domingo

texts.es: Jairo, tiene 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos, y reside en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Inicio realizando trabajos de carpintería pero hace dos años en busca de obtener mas ingresos decidió poner una pulpería en su casa. Ofrece productos alimenticios como refrescos, churros, carnes, embutidos,  mariscos, dulces, productos lácteos y otros básicos. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de carnes, churros, dulces, lácteos y embutidos para la venta, con el fin de ampliar su negocio mantenerlo surtido y llegar a convertirlo en un minisúper.
texts.en:
Jairo is 23 years old. He and his partner are in common-law relationship and have two children. They reside in the town of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. He started out doing carpentry work. Two years ago, he began looking for ways to generate more income, so he decided to set up a store in his house. Jairo offers food products such as soft drinks, snack foods, meats, sausages, seafood, sweets, dairy products, and other basic staples.

The loan he is requesting is in the amount of 15,000 HNL. This money will be invested in the purchase of meats, snack foods, dairy products, and sausages to sell. In the end, he will expand his business by maintaining his inventory and converting it into a mini-supermarket.

loans.use: to buy meats, snack foods, dairy products, and sausages to sell.

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es: Marta de 44 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante su tienda de productos de primera necesidad  y una pequeña panadería los cuales son su principal ingreso, y el apoyo con el que cuenta para sacar adelante a su hijos, junto a su esposo que también se desempeña como panificador. Marta logró mejorar su negocio gracias a un crédito adquirido con FUSAI con el cual logró ampliar sus negocios, observando que su clientela ha mejorado, Marta desea seguir invirtiendo en la tienda y su pequeña panadería por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para  invertir en: harina, manteca, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, maicillo, sachets de champú, jabón, detergente, etc. para seguir ampliando su producción  de la panadería y surtir los productos de su tienda. Marta agradece a FUSAI por el apoyo y confianza otorgado por lo que manifiesta sentirse satisfecha con el apoyo recibido.
texts.en:
Marta is 44, and lives in her own home with her husband and their three children, ages 17, 15 and 13.

She is a woman who thanks to her effort and tenacity has managed to keep her businesses going: a store selling basic necessities, as well as a small bakery. These are her main sources of income and the support she and her husband have for raising their children. Her husband also works as a baker.

Marta managed to improve her business thanks to a loan she received from FUSAI with which she managed to expand her businesses; and she has seen her clientele increase. 

Marta wishes to continue investing in the store and in her small bakery,  and is therefore requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy flour, lard, sugar, rice, beans, sorghum, shampoo sachets, soap, detergent, etc.  This is so that she can continue expanding the production of her bakery and stock products for her store.

Maria is grateful to FUSAI for the support and trust granted her and says she is happy about the support received.

loans.use: To buy flour, lard, sugar, rice, beans, sorghum, shampoo sachets, soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Chillavi Group

texts.es:
MARCIA ha vivido desde siempre en una comunidad llamada “Chillavi del Agua” tiene 42 años – 8 hijos y todos viven con ella.
Es de familia muy humilde – desde hace más de tres años ella se separó de su pareja por motivos que el había formado otro hogar. Desde ese momento MARCIA trabaja muy duro para que sus hijos tengan todo lo necesario.
Su hija mayor se ha graduado en la secundaria y sus otros hijos continúan estudiando. Comenta que es muy difícil pero que el sacrificio por sus hijos la recompensara algún día.
MARCIA gestiona el segundo crédito con FODEMI y desde su primer crédito se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos en pie y por libras en su comunidad. Con el valor que recibirá en este crédito ella comprara más pollos pequeños y así continuar su productiva actividad familiar.
Menciona que la ayuda de estos créditos a través de FODEMI -  cambian mucho la vida de las personas que tienen sus ideas de negocios y muchas veces generan trabajo a otras personas.
INFORMACION ADICIONAL
El grupo “CHILLAVI”  está conformado por 11 personas – dos de ellos reciben $500,00 – ocho reciben $700 y uno recibirá $600 dólares. En su comunidad cuentan ya con servicio de agua potable pero carecen de centro de salud y en momentos de emergencias tienen que acudir a poblaciones cercanas. Como grupo ellos están gestionando con las autoridades para tener un pequeño centro de salud y una farmacia en este sector.
texts.en:
Marcia has always lived in a community called Chillavi del Agua.  She is 42 years old and has eight children, all of whom live with her. She comes from a very poor family. More than three years ago, she separated from her partner because he had started another family. Marcia is working very hard to meet her children’s needs. Her oldest daughter has graduated from secondary school and her other children continue in school. She says that things are very difficult but that the sacrifice she is making for her children will be recompensed some day.

Marcia is taking part in the second round of credit with FODEMI. From the time of her first loan, she has dedicated herself to the raising and sale of live and butchered chickens by the pound in her community. 

With the money that she will receive with this loan, she will buy additional chicks and continue this productive family business. She also says that the assistance from these loans from FODEMI changes the lives of people who have ideas for businesses and many times these businesses generate work for others. 

The Chillavi group is made up of 11 people. Two will receive $500, eight will receive $700 and one will receive $600.  In their community they now have potable water but they lack a health center. In emergencies, they have to go to nearby communities. As a group, they are working with the authorities to have a small health center and pharmacy in this community.

loans.use: to buy more small chickens and thus continue a productive family business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his cocona crop, clear his fields, and pay for organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.en:
Adolfo knows some things about resilience and success. He has immigrated twice, once from his native Cuba to Venezuela, and four years ago to the United States, where he opened his jewelry store, Greyca Jewelry Inc.
 
Despite confronting the challenges of being uprooted, Adolfo and his family have managed to adjust, and Greyca has grown with them. Nestled in a corner of the Sedano supermarket in Miami’s iconic Hialeah neighborhood, Greyca carries beautiful necklaces, watches, rings, and pendants of fine gold and silver. Adolfo knows his merchandise well, as he owned a similar business in Venezuela. 

He says that while jewelry is his passion, accessing capital has been a constant challenge. He has been wanting to update and modernize the display cases used for the jewelry for a long time, but has not had the capital to do so. 

Adolfo needs this loan to buy new display cases for his jewelry, as well as invest in a marketing strategy. Adolfo and his family have come a long way, but need some help to secure Greyca Jewelry’s future.

loans.use: to purchase a new display rack for merchandise, and marketing material.

loans.name: Vinton

texts.en:
Vinton grew up admiring successful music producers like Berry Gordy of Motown Records, and Russell Simmons of Def Jam Recordings. Born and raised in Miami, he always felt that the city was missing something that these music legends produced.  This inspired him to found Valholla Entertainment nine years ago, a fresh home-based record label that’s shaking things up. 
   
“My company helps to fulfill a musical void in the city of Miami due to a lack of musicians that represent the city of Miami on a larger scale.”

Valholla offers its talent a variety of services, such as music production and recording, marketing and booking. Currently Valholla represents five artists, including hip-hop artists Kim Maurier and Ramzez. While Vinton is proud of the success Valholla has brought him and his artists, as well as its contribution to the Miami music scene, he feels that his lack of working capital is hindering the company’s growth. 
 
“Without proper funding, it’s difficult to move the company to the next level. Many of the music projects released by Valholla have been financed out of my pocket. This puts a limit on our artistic output as well as the quantity and quality of our releases.”

Vinton’s loan will help Valholla expand and improve the quality of its output. “Photo shoots and music videos are needed to provide visuals to the artist’s songs, which will invoke more interest in the artist and their music.” he says. Help Vinton and Valholla become the premiere record label in Miami, and check out the amazing artists you’re supporting at www.valholla.com.

loans.use: to pay for videos and photos of his label's recording artists.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David helps people solve tough problems. Math problems, that is. He’s always been fascinated by math and knows how difficult it is for most people. As a result, he decided to share his passion with others, and founded Math Academy LLC, a math tutoring company for high school, undergraduate and graduate students. In addition to helping individuals improve their math skills, David also helps educators develop math curricula. Since launching Math Academy, his business has grown considerably. 

“I love being able to make a living doing what I love, and being able to employ five tutors part-time. Ultimately, I’d like to have them working full-time.”

In order to take his business to the next level, David needs to expand his outreach and marketing strategy. Until now, most of his clients have been referred by word of mouth and basic advertising at schools, but Math Academy is in urgent need of a website.

The loan David is requesting will go towards building a website, and launching a long-term marketing strategy.  Additionally, it will help David build his credit.

loans.use: to invest in a website and marketing strategy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy furnishings for a bedroom in his house.

loans.name: La Gloire De Dieu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kalendi est commerçante et secrétaire de la banque villageoise La Gloire de Dieu, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 46 ans, mère de 3 enfants scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu  de son mari. Elle est vendeuse et s'entraide avec son mari, propriétaire d’une boutique à domicile sur l'avenue animée depuis 15 ans. Elle va acheter de divers articles manufacturés : des cartons de jus, cosmétiques, riz, sardines, sucre, biscuits, matelas, farine de format etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Our client Kalendi is an entrepreneur and secretary of the La Gloire de Dieu [Glory of God] banc villageois. She is a client of the Hekima microfinance institution, 46 years old, and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She launched her business with the funds received from her husband. She works as a vendor, jointly with her husband, who has been running a basic goods shop out of their home at a busy street for 15 years. She will buy various commercially produced grocery items: boxes of juice, cosmetics, rice, sardines, sugar, biscuits, mattresses, wheat flour etc. She would like to be able to take out  more loans and be able to provide for her children. Finally she thanks Hekima for its support of women who lack access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to  buy various goods: boxes of juice, cosmetics, rice, sardines, sugar, biscuits, mattresses, wheat flour etc.

loans.name: Ma. Nenita

texts.en:
Ma. Nenita is 35 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Nenita earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been doing pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from a general store and selling dried fish. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 47 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Ma. Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, sugar, milk, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell.

Ma. Victoria has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, sugar, milk, coffee, noodles, etc.

Ma. Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, sugar, milk, coffee, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Madelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Madelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Van, 33, is an experienced and active farmer. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around USD 2.50 a day to support her family’s daily expenses. She is a lovely mother of two dependent children who are enrolling in the local school.

To accelerate her farming operation, Van would like to use horses to help her in the farming process. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy horses. 

She hopes that the support from this loan can help her a lot in her farming operation. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy horses to help her in the farming process.

loans.name: Aminadac Nixon

texts.es: Aminadac de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 18 y 22 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se desempeña como transportista de materiales como: ladrillos, arena, grava, mudanzas, etc. y es gracias a dicha actividad que el logra sostener la estabilidad económica en su hogar. En la vivienda de Aminadac se encuentra un cuarto al que desea colocarle ladrillo de piso y techo, pero por falta de recursos económicos no lo ha logrado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina, polines, pines, ladrillo de piso, cemento y arena para colocarle ladrillo de piso y techo a su cuarto.
texts.en:
Aminadac is 42 years old. He lives in his own house with his life partner and his two children, who are 18 and 22 years old, respectively.

He is an enterprising man, he works as a truck driver. He transports materials such as, bricks, sand, gravel, he also does movings, etc. Thanks to this occupation he can support his family. In Aminadac's house there is a room that he wishes to cover with bricks, the floor and the ceiling, but he hasn't been able to do it because he lacks the financial resources. 

He is requesting FUSAI a loan to invest in sheet, rollers, pins, bricks, cement, and sand to cover with bricks the floor and the ceiling of this room.

loans.use: to invest in: sheet, rollers, pins, bricks, cement, and sand to cover with bricks the floor and the ceiling of a room.

loans.name: Loeu

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Loeu, 53, is an experienced and active farmer. At home, she is the lovely mother of one dependent child and one married child. She is the owner of a cashew plantation. By operating a farming business on her small plantation, she can earn around USD 2.50 a day to support her family's daily expenses. So far, she has been involved in this career for around thirty years.

To keep her cashews growing well with more fruit, Loeu is going to use natural fertilizers on her farmland. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan via HKL to buy fertilizers to use in her farming process this farming season. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it can make her cashews grow better and produce more crops for her. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny has owned Printer Solutions for 20 years.  With the help of his wife Donna, Danny provides printer repair and consulting services for businesses in the Santa Clarita Valley area. 

Danny enjoys the freedom and independence owning his own business affords and he would like to be able to employ Donna full-time.  However, clients are often slow to pay and the inventory stock is small.  The latter can become a serious problem since he deals with multiple clients and a variety of printers that require maintenance and repairs.  

“My vision is to have a complete inventory on hand so there is no lag time for clients waiting for parts” he says.  In order to maintain the small family business, Danny knows he has to remain competitive. and this means getting his clients what they need, faster. 

Danny needs this loan to diversify his inventory and secure the contracts he needs to keep Printer Solutions in business. He estimates that with a little investment, he’ll be able to “increase worth by 15% each year with maintenance contracts.”

loans.use: to purchase inventory,

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her since she was able to purchase quantities of raw materials, like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 10,000, to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and business expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Presentacion hopes that her business will continue to help provide for their everyday needs. She also desires to have a prosperous life and a happy family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Toni

texts.en:
Toni is the owner of The Elite Dance and Performing Arts Center in Woodland Hills. She offers dance classes and, birthday parties, and she sells dancewear for adults and children.  The staff offers ballet, tap, jazz, hip-hop, ballroom, acrobatics, and even Zumba classes for children and adults. 

Most of the marketing is done through word of mouth and social media but Toni does send out mailers, post cards, and brochures to different schools in the community. She has hired one staff member as Marketing Manager to help her contact different schools, attend all school events, and market the company's dance classes. 

The Elite Dance and Performing Arts Center Inc. is seeking $5,000 loan to pay rent while they renovate an extra room in the studio to add more dance classes.

loans.use: To pay three months of rent while they renovate an extra room in the studio to add more dance classes

loans.name: Imaculada

texts.en: Imaculada is applying for a loan of $800. She is married and she has a kiosk. She is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including sugar, shampoo, biscuits, aqua, sardines, candies, lighters, cooking oil and other things to sell Including hard drinks and soft drinks.  She started her business in 2011 with a working capital of $600. She has a plan for the future to open a big store, so she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to have a good management for her business and to increase her income in the future. She is happy with the loan Tuba Rai Metin offered her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy sugar, shampoo, biscuits, aqua, sardines, candies, lighters, cooking oil and other things to sell including hard drinks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rodrigo Carlos

texts.es:
Rodrigo es un hombre joven de 22 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la compra y venta de salteñas.
Él es emprendedor, inteligente, decidido, constante, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Buenos Aires, que es un lugar caracterizado por el abundante comercio en todas las áreas.
Rodrigo es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara el cual casi no utiliza porque en el comercio y los estudios se utiliza el español. Su negocio es la venta de Salteñas, Tucumanas y rellenos de papa; cada día el realiza la compra por mayor de estos productos y se encarga de venderlos de forma ambulante en plazas y clientes diarios, generando una ganancia económica para utilizarla en sus estudios. Él estudia comunicación audiovisual en un instituto privado, y necesita realizar la compra de una cámara filmadora y una laptop como herramientas de estudio. Su sueño es ser profesional y dedicarse a trabajar en su carrera.
Es por esos motivos que Rodrigo solicita un préstamo para la compra de una laptop y una cámara filmadora para realizar sus estudios sin problemas.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a young man who is 22 years old. He is single and does not have any children. He works selling meat patties. He is entrepreneurial, intelligent, dedicated, loyal, responsible and very hardworking. He runs his business in the Buenos Aires zone of town, an area characterized by its abundant commerce. 

Rodrigo has short dark hair, a tan complexion and is of average height. His native language is aymara, which he rarely speaks because he uses Spanish in his business and his studies.

He sells "Salteñas" made in the Tucuman style, filled with potatoes. He makes his purchases each day and buys in bulk, then sells the salteñas by foot in the plazas and to some regular clients. He earns enough to pay for his studies.

He studies audiovisual communication in a private institution and needs to purchase a videocamera and a laptop to use for school. His dream is to be a professional and dedicate himself to the career of audiovisual communication. For this reason, Rodrigo is requesting a loan to buy the computer and camera in order to realize his studies without any problems.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop and a video camera.

loans.name: Martinha

texts.en:
Martinha requests  $ 600.00 to improve her business and buy  biscuits, coffee, rubber bands, shampoo, sugar, candies, cigarettes, soft drinks and other items. 

Martinha opened her kiosk in 2012 with $ 360.00 of her own money. She is pleased with the loan available through Tuba Rai Metin. 

She hopes to open a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, coffee, rubber bands, shampoo, sugar, candies, cigarettes, soft drinks and other items..

loans.name: Samut

texts.en:
Samut is a 52-year-old woman with seven children, one attends university and two attend school. She lives in Kampong Cham province, 

She  grows rubber, rice, and cassava to earn an income. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully  repaid  her previous loans which enabled her to gradually  improve her lifestyle. 

She will use the loan to buy a solar panel to provide her home with electricity.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
At the age of 42 years old, Srey is living in a community of Prey Chhor District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of nine unmarried children and one married child. To support the family, she is working very hard on her own rice field by growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers and customers in the market. The net profit that she can generate is USD 5 a day. 

To keep her rice growing well with more fruit, she normally uses natural fertilizers on her farmland. However, now she can’t effort that fertilizer as she used to do regularly. She is now requesting a loan to buy some fertilizers to use on her rice farmland. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy some fertilizers

loans.name: Ana May

texts.en:
Ana May is a married woman and a mother of four young children from Carles, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than ten years now. This is the source of her income. 

Ana May is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and a boat engine. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.  

In the future, Ana May hopes to make their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and a boat engine

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita, a wife and a mother of six children, signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Benita is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan of PHP 20,000 from PMPC to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. 

In the future, Benita hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 62-year-old married woman with seven adult children from Baybay, Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living raising hogs and selling various  items to the people in her area. Her husband is a farmer.

Leonora asks for a loan to buy  bread,  biscuits , canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, cooking oil, sugar, seasonings and other items.

She will be able to improve her inventory and attract more customers. In the future, Leonora hopes to be successful and earn additional income.

loans.use: to buy bread,  biscuits , canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, cooking oil, sugar, seasonings and other items.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva signed up for membership with PMPC and accessed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time borrower like her. Eva was able to turn the tide in her favor and makes good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she accessed a loan to restock her store with basic items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her rug-making business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Aida hopes for her business to continue flourishing and helping with their everyday needs. She meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Sam Art

texts.en: A farmer from Kampong Cham province, Sam Art is 60 years old and a mother of five children; one of whom is studying in university. For her living, Sam Art grows cassava and peppers to support her family. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She wants to focus on her daughter's education. Therefore, she has applied for a loan in order to pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Biography. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: To pay tuition fee for her daughter

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel works hard to support her family and 3 children.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and  earns additional income raising poultry. Hazel requests 29,500 PHP through NWTF  to purchase kitchenware and ingredients for her food business.

Hazel has sustained her business  through eleven previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to educated her children.

loans.use: to purchase kitchenware and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Sa Im

texts.en:
Sa Im is 34 years old and a mother of three school-aged children, they live in Kampong Cham province. 

Her main source of income is growing rubber and cassava. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan to buy a solar panel to provide electricity for our house.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Srouy

texts.en:
Srouy is 33 years old and lives in Kompong Thom province. She has one child and he is studying at the university. 

Srouy sells bicycles and raises pigs to support her family. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her previous loans which enabled her to gradually improve her living conditions. 

Srouy will use her  loan to pay her son's school fee.  He wants to earn a bachelor's degree in Accounting. She hopes that her son can get a new job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay school fee for her son.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel operates a business and supervises the renovation of his home. Samuel hopes to live comfortably and will use the 48,000 PHP loan to replace his roof. 

He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing and continue his good repayment record. He is very thankful for his support from  PMPC.

loans.use: to pay house renovation costs.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy thought he was in the right place when he joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC.He decided to give it a try after he learned he can obtain financial assistance for his  business. 

Juvy has maintained his membership without defaulting on payments. He has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. He will use the new loan to purchase large quantities of feed and animal vitamins. Juvy wishes to manage his business  effectively with the support of his family.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of her home. She will use $ 20,000 PHP to purchase a good roof and  live comfortably. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with good repayment record. She is thankful for the support provided by PMPC.

loans.use: to pay house renovation costs.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 39 years old with four children. Jennifer personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  Since she joined Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost three years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 20,000 for the purchase of new nets and other fishing accessories.  

As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch.  She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish at the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets and other fishing accessories

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana  is 37 years old and mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by trade; he sells fruit, e.g. apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household expenses.


Farzana's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales, and earn maximum profit. But due to their unfavorable financial position, he is not able to purchase fruit for his business purposes.

Therefore Farzana  has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruit for her husband to sell

loans.name: Mark  Joel Lou

texts.en:
In the year 2010, Mark learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jump start his corn production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Mark feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business. 

Recently, he accessed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next crop season. Mark wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply corn in the neigboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en: A local farmer who is living in Kampong Speu province, Yet is 51 years old and a widowed mother blessed with four children in school. To support her family, she earns income via growing rice, earning about 30,000 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that she can lives more healthily than before.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for her family.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Moises

texts.en:
Moises, 66 years old, lives in Pines, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. His wife does not have a job.  He has found ways to earn income through a snack & food business.  He joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped him with his  sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2004. 

He became a MIGS member and received several loans.  He requests 14,900 PHP to buy merchandise for his sari-sari store. He hopes to continue the business  and someday own a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his sari-sari store.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Bernadette hopes that her business will become more established. She also desires to improve the general living condition of her family. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn, 50, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Speu province. He is a father of four children. He struggles for a living via rice cropping, and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. 

For Horn, this is his first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of two to get new loan. As the group leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. He hopes that this latrine can update his family’s living in healthy conditions.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Khatt's Group

texts.en: An older woman who lives in Kampong Speu province, Khatt is 60 years old and a mother of three children. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family via growing rice and selling grocery items to supplement her income. She earns an income of about 30,000 KHR per day. For Khatt, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group of five to get a loan. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions so they are more healthy.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en: An older woman living in Kampong Speu province, Un is 60 years old and a mother of four children. To support her family, she grows rice as their single source of income, and it generates a decent income for her. She earns about 39,300 KHR per day. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has fully repaid, have uplifted her lifestyle gradually. In this group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can update her family's living conditions so they will be healthier.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en: A resident living in Kampong Speu province, Pheap is 53 years old and a mother of six schoolchildren. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cultivating. She can earn almost 31,600 KHR per day from her income-generating activity. For Pheap, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group of four to get loan. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions and keep them in good health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for her family.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Marc B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Annytha est commerçante et présidente de la banque  communautaire Marc B, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 29 ans, mère de 4 enfants scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu  de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des pagnes depuis 2 ans. Son conjoint est un agent dans une brasserie. Elle va acheter  110 pièces de pagnes. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Annytha is a shopkeeper and president of Marc B Group, a community banking group and client of [microfinance institution] Hekima. Annytha is married, 29 years old, and the mother of four children attending school.

Annytha began her business with funds she received from her husband. She has been selling pagnes [pieces of traditional cloth] for two years. Her spouse is a brasserie manager. Annytha is going to purchase 110 pagnes. She hopes to increase her credit, feed her children, send them to school, and help them grow. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support they provide to entrepreneurs who lack access to finance through the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To purchase 110 pagnes [pieces of traditional cloth].

loans.name: Numia

texts.en: Numia is 52 years old and married with six children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oils, etc. In the future, Numia hopes to earn money to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Miduvi Borbon Group

texts.es:
KATTY  vive en Borbón desde hace 8 años – tiene 6 hijos de edades entre 6 y 14 años – está separada de su pareja y junto a sus hijos se dedica a la cría de pollos – actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años. Y en la que invertirá nuevamente 100 pollos pequeños para su cría y venta dentro de 6 semanas
Ella es de familia muy vulnerable a demás ella realiza tareas domésticas en una casa de familia. Sus hijos le apoyan es el cuidado y alimentación de los pollos.
KATTY fue invitada a participar de este grupo por la representante, líder que levanta la mano en la fotografía – quien notò en KATTY el espíritu de compromiso – mucha responsabilidad – y ganas de trabajar. Ella vende el producto de su trabajo en las tiendas de BORBON y a los vecinos.
KATTY se describe como una persona muy responsable – dinámica – amigable y con muchos deseos de superación para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
Nos dice que FODEMI es la solución a las ideas de progreso que puede tener una persona de bajos recursos – ya que con un pequeño capital puede ayudar a su familia y su comunidad.
texts.en:
Katty has lived in Borbón for 8 years. She has 6 children from 6 to 14 years old. She is separated from her husband, and she makes her living raising chickens with the help of her children. She has been doing this activity for 6 years, and she plans to buy 100 small chickens to raise and sell within 6 weeks. She sells her chickens in the shops of Borbón and to neighbors. 
Her family is very vulnerable, and she also works doing domestic chores for a family in their house. Her children help her with the care and feeding of chickens. Katty was invited to participate in this group by the leader, with her hand raised in the photograph, who noted in Katty the spirit of commitment, a lot of responsibility, and the desire to work. Katty describes herself as a very responsible, dynamic, and friendly person who is eager to get ahead in order to support her children in their studies. 
She tells us that FODEMI is the solution to the ideas of progress that a low-income person might have—because with just a little capital, one can help his or her family and community.

loans.use: to buy 100 small chickens to raise and sell within 6 weeks, and in this way offer her neighbors quality food.

loans.name: Proem

texts.en:
Proem, thirty years old, is married and has two children. The family lives in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To help support the family, she grows rice and sells the crop to customers in the marketplace and local dealers. She earns approximately 5 USD a day.

Proem normally uses organic fertilizers on her fields, but circumstances have lately meant that she can’t afford this fertilizer. She is now requesting a 1,600,000 KHR loan through HKL to buy more for her farmland.

Proem would like to thank all lenders for the financial support she will receive through HKL, as it offers her a much lower interest rate than its general loan products.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Speu province, Chanthy is 44 years old and a mother of four children. For her living, she grows rice on three hectares of land and sells grocery items to earn more income. She has involved these businesses for ages and earns about 27,200 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For this group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that she will have a latrine for her family's use.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny, 25, is a farmer living in Kampong Speu Province and the father of a young child. He struggles to make a living via rice cropping and working for others for a fee. His wife is a tailor, so this business can earn them more income to support their family. Now he can earn an income of about 30,000 KHR per day.

For Ny, this is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of three to get a new loan. As a leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. He hopes that when his family has a decent latrine to use, they can live in good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Marc A Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sara est commerçante dynamique de la banque villageoise Marc A, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un chauffeur, âgée de 36 ans, mère de 4 enfants scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse et propriétaire d’un magasin dans une gallérie de la ville depuis  11 ans. Elle va acheter de divers articles des basins, casseroles, seaux, chauffe eau, rechauds, cuisinières. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Sara is an energetic shopkeeper in Marc A Group, a client of [microfinance institution] Hekima. She is 36 years old, married to a driver, and the mother of four children attending school. She began her business with funds she received from her husband.

Sara has been a retailer and proprietor of a shop in a small shopping center in town for 11 years. She is going to purchase various goods: bowls, pans, buckets, water heaters, portable stoves, and stoves. She hopes to increase her credit and feed her children. Sara would like to end by thanking Hekima for the support they provide to entrepreneurs who lack access to finance through the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To purchase various goods: bowls, pans, buckets, water heaters, and stoves.

loans.name: Chinzorig

texts.en:
Chinzorig, 35 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a systems coordinator at a bank since 2009, and his wife is systems engineer at a mining company. Their children go to high school.

On his day off, Chinzorig transports goods between districts for extra income. His truck now needs some repairs, so he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT through Credit Mongol to buy parts for it.

loans.use: to buy parts with which to repair his truck

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en:
Yim, 39, is a farmer who is living in Kampong Speu province. She is a mother of three schoolchildren. She struggles for a living via rice cropping on a one-and-a-half-hectare area, and works for others for a fee to earn more income. She earns income of about 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is Yim’s seventh loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of six members to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family’s living conditions to be more healthy.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Sina is 39 years old and the father of four children. At this time, he still needs to support two schoolchildren. Rice farming is the sole source of income for his entire family, and he has been occupied in this business for 21 years. He can earn an income of about 22,000 KHR per day to support his family.

This is Sina's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three, he is a leader and he will spend his loan portion to build a decent latrine for his family. He hopes that he can provide improved healthy living for his family.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for his family.

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en:
Chhim, 51, lives with his wife in a small village of Kampong Cham province. So far, this couple have three dependent children and two married children. Chhim and his wife are farmers in a small rice farmland near their house. Until now they have been involving in this career for fifteen years with an average income of USD 10 a day.

To keep his rice growing well with more yield, Chhim is going to use natural fertilizers on his farmland. Because there is a shortage of money, he would like to get a KIVA loan via KHL to buy fertilizers to use in his farming process in this farming season. With the support of this loan, he hopes that he can make his rice grow better and produce more yield for him.  He also thanks all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap, who is a 47-year-old woman, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four unmarried children and one married child. To make a living and support her family, she has been involved with a rice farming business on a small farm since 1999. The average income that she can make is USD 5.00 per day.

For supplementary income, she wants to raise many ducklings at her house to re-sell them when they are big enough. Because she does not have enough money to start this venture, she has now applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy the ducklings. With the support from this loan, she hopes that income from her new business will help to improve her living standard. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support of poor people.

loans.use: to buy ducklings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Eletise

texts.en: Eletise is 41 years old and a solo parent with two children. She would like to start a small business, sewing and selling clothes in her community. In order to do this, Eletise needs a loan to buy materials, thread, needles, scissors, and a sewing machine. She hopes to use her profits to support her children's education and to support her family as well. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy materials, thread, scissors, a sewing machine, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel, 44 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Their elder daughter works as a manager in the service department of a bank. Their younger daughter studies at university.

Odgerel and her husband have been running an automobile repair shop since 2001. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy diagnostic equipment in order to improve service and client satisfaction.

loans.use: to buy diagnostic equipment for her automobile repair shop in order to improve service

loans.name: Taiva

texts.en: Taiva is 63 years old and a widow with 4 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling consumer items such as snacks, sugar, flour, meat pies, drinks, and ie lavava (detergent) etc. She has been doing this for 4 years. Taiva needs a loan to buy stock for her shop such as flour, sugar and boxes of chicken. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her shop: flour, sugar, noodles, boxes of chicken, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Evamel

texts.en: Evamel is 36 and a mother of two who manages her own flower shop to make a living. She earns a good income from this business that sustains the needs of her children. She works hard for this business in order to improve it, for it is her only way of earning. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to improve her flower shop by adding more pots of flowers. She is hoping that through this business, she will be able to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to improve her flower shop by adding more pots of flowers.

loans.name: Robby

texts.en:
41-year-old Robby continues to grow his Zoona mobile transfer business. He would like to thank all his Kiva lenders for their continued support through lending him money.  The loans have helped him grow his business. 

Robby has expanded his business by opening six Zoona mobile money transfer outlets. He now employs ten young people across his trading booths to help him run the business.

He enjoys his business because he is able to interact with different people every day and his business helps him stay capable of taking care of his family. Robby is requesting a Kiva loan to help him purchase a trading booth for his seventh outlet.

loans.use: To purchase a Zoona-branded trading booth where he can conduct his business

loans.name: Clement And Tresfold Group

texts.en:
Clement, 29, and Tresfold, 37, have been business partners for three years. They own a Zoona mobile money transfer business in Lusaka, Zambia. Their business provides financial services such as mobile money and bill payments. Both Clement and Tresfold are married. Clement has a one-year-old son.

This is Clement and Tresfold’s second Kiva loan. They got their first loan in October of 2013. The loan helped them to serve more customers, so they were able to increase their working capital float, and this enabled them to serve customers who were sending and receiving large amounts of money. This increased their profit margins. From the profits, Clement and Tresfold bought two laptops and installed wireless Internet at their shop. This made their transactions much faster. Clement says their standard of living has also improved.

Clement and Tresfold are requesting a second Kiva loan, so that they can purchase a trading booth. This booth will be placed outside the main bus station to service customers who do not want to go into the busy bus station. Adding another outlet will increase their revenue.

Clement and Tresfold have dreams of becoming the biggest mobile money transfer business in Lusaka. They are grateful to the Kiva lenders for the continued support.

loans.use: To open another outlet outside one of the biggest bus stations in Lusaka

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara has grown into an ambitious young woman. She is 24 years old and born fourth in a family of five. Her mother and father are not employed. Tamara operates a Zoona mobile money transfer outlet in Kafue, Zambia to earn income and take care of her family. 

Tamara has been operating her business for close to three years now. This is her second Kiva loan. Her first loan came in March of 2012, right when she was starting her business. The loan was used for her to add to her working capital and have the ability to serve more customers. She also used some of the loan to purchase a small computer. The computer helped her to serve her customers faster. She says this helped her business receive new customers, as she did not have long queues.

Currently, Tamara is seeking a second loan so she can open an additional outlet nearby in Kafue. The money will be used to purchase a trading booth, where her customers will transact. She says this will help her business grow because she will get new customers. She will also hire a new employee to assist with running the new outlet. 

Tamara is hopeful that opening a second shop will double her current profits. The profits will improve her standard of living and that of her son.

loans.use: To purchase a small booth so that she can open a new outlet and grow her business

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is 40 years old and married with six children. She wants to start a small business making and selling chips in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bananas, taro, salt, containers, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Elisapeta hopes to earn money to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bananas, taro, salt, containers, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Leatafale

texts.en:
Leatafale is 48 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling donuts, meat pies, pineapple pies, etc., in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

She has requested a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, oil, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Leatafale will support her child and also her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Mitavale

texts.en:
Mitavale is a 55-year-old woman who is married and has five children. For the past four years she has sold such groceries as sugar, salt, rice, snacks, chicken legs, etc. to her community members.

Mitavale has been a member of SPBD since 2012. She has applied for a 2,500 WST loan to buy bags of sugar and flour, salt, snacks, boxes of frozen chicken, etc. She plans to use her profits to help her family and support her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Meet Tina. She used her first Kiva loan to pay in full for her trading booth in Chingwe which she uses to serve her customers. The loan helped her to save on rental costs and she was able to earn more profits from her business.

Tina wants to let her Kiva lenders know that her profits have improved, and this has helped her move to a better house and to buy a television set.

Tina is now applying for a second Kiva loan which she plans to use to finance a second Zoona money transfer shop in her town of Chongwe. Tina’s new outlet will offer mobile money transfers and Mobile Airtime to more rural customers. With this loan, she will be able to buy a new trading booth. She has saved up enough money to serve her customers.

Tina is hopeful that once she opens her second shop, her revenue will double and she will be able to improve her education through distance learning. She would like to go back to school and study Accounting, so that she can apply the principles to her business. Tina thanks the Kiva lenders for their support with the growth of her Zoona mobile money transfer business.

loans.use: to finance a second Zoona money transfer shop in her town of Chongwe.

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es: Rodolfo de 20 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida. Él es un joven trabajador que se especializa en la apicultura, que consiste en el trabajo de mantenimiento de colmenas, en el cual el debe sustraer la miel de los cuadros dentro de la colmena. Rodolfo desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida, repellando su vivienda y construyendo ventanas a la misma, pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y  ventanas para repellar su vivienda y colocarle ventanas.
texts.en: Rodolfo is 20 years old and he lives in his own house with his life partner. He is a hardworking young man who engages in apiculture, and his job is to care for the beehives: he is responsible for detaching honey form the hive. Rodolfo would like to improve his standard of living, by whitewashing his house and placing windows, but he does not have enough money, and for this reason he asked FUSAI for a loan in order to invest it in the purchase of cement, sand and windows, in order to whitewash his house and place windows.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and windows for his house.

loans.name: Jephtah

texts.en:
Jephtah is 33 years old. He lives with his two brothers ages 24 and 20 years old. He runs a Zoona mobile money transfer business. His business provides financial service to people in his community. The business is his only source of income. 

He loves his business because it gives him a chance to interact with other small  business owners. He operates his business in a high-density area called Chingwere compound. The profits from his business help him to pay for his rentals and take care of his brothers.

Jephtah is requesting a Kiva loan to enable him purchase a trading booth.  He will use the booth to service more customers.

His dream is to expand  his business by opening more Zoona outlets. This will help him to make more profits and improve his standard of living. He has hopes of going back to school one day.

loans.use: To purchase a trading booth

loans.name: Sivigi

texts.en: Sivigi is 52 years old and married with 7 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for 5 years. Sivigi has requested a loan to buy a big cooler, ice, a spear, fishing gear, fishing glasses, etc. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. Sivigi will use her earnings to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a big cooler, ice, fishing gear, goggles, a spear, fishing shoes, etc.

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en:
Bendita is married and her husband works in agriculture. She is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as soaps, scissors, milks, biscuits, sardines, soy sauce, ketchup, perfumes, candles, cooking oils and other things to sell, including hard drinks and soft drinks. 

Bendita opened her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $250. She is taking this loan because she has a plan to open a big store in the future. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin because it gives her more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy soaps, scissors, milks, biscuits, sardines, soy sauce, ketchup, perfumes, candles, cooking oils and other things to sell, including hard drinks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Masoud

texts.en:
Masoud, who is in his late fifties, is married and has got seven children, five grownup and two still at school. Masoud was a civil servant up to the late 1990s, when he retired and started a business as a way to sustain his family life. The same year he retired he started a stationery business, selling stationery of different types, and also providing printing and photocopy services.
