He works at his business from 08:30am to 09:00pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

He has been with Tujijenge Tanzania as Kiva's partner for fifteen credit cycles. He is so thankful with Kiva's support since his business now grows and he is able to fill more orders, sometimes up to midnight. He used the previous credits, since repaid successfully, to buy a photocopy machine, a printer and printing papers. 

Masoud has done a good job. He received profit which he used to build a house and to cover both school fees and household expenses. His desire is to improve and increase his business to earn more income. He will be accountable for paying back the loan. 

He will invest this loan in printing papers and other stationery.

loans.use: to buy printing papers and other stationery.

loans.name: Faatietie

texts.en:
Faatietie is a 27-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small garden and grows cabbages to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

She has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, seeds, knives, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Faatietie hopes to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, seeds, knives, etc.

loans.name: Rajabmo

texts.ru:
Ражабмо по жизни трудолюбивая, отзывчивая и великодушная женщина. Она родилась в сельской местности в районе Хуросон и по сей день живет там со своей семьей. У Ражабмо двое сыновей и дочь. Старший сын женат и вместе с женой живет в доме матери. Сыновья Ражабмо в настоящий момент находятся в России на заработках.
Ражабмо уже исполнилось 61 год, и она уже 25 лет как продолжает свой животноводческий бизнес. Она занимается ремеслом своих предков и научилась этому делу еще в юности у своей бабушки и дедушки. Ражабмо разводит коров и быков. Благодаря своему делу она обеспечивает семью не только доходом, но и молоком и молочными продуктами. В настоящий момент Ражабмо хочет увеличить поголовье своих скотов и с такой целью обратилась за кредитом. На всю сумму кредита она собирается приобрести скот. Ражабмо верит в вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Rajabmo is a hardworking, responsive and generous woman. She was born in a rural area in the Khuroson district and lives there to this day with her family. Rajabmo has two sons and a daughter. The oldest son is married and lives with his wife in his mother's home. Rajabmo's sons are currently working in Russia. Rajabmo already turned 61 years old, and she has been running her animal husbandry business for 25 years. She is involved in a trade of her ancestors and learned this business in her youth from her grandmother and grandfather. Rajabmo raises cow and bulls. Thanks to her business, she is able to provide the family not only with an income, but also with milk and dairy products. At the present time, Rajabmo wants to increase her livestock headcount and requested a loan for this purpose. She is planning to use the entire loan amount to buy livestock. Rajabmo believes in your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
At the age of 35, Phoeun is living in a community of the Prey Chhor District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has one unmarried child. To support the family, she is working very hard on her own rice field, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers and customers in the market. The net profit that she can generate is USD 5.00 a day. 

To keep her crop growing well with more grains of rice, she normally uses natural fertilizers in her farmland. However, now she can’t afford that fertilizer as she used to do regularly. She is now requesting a loan to buy some fertilizer to use on her rice farmland. She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than that of its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy some fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles comes from a village in Kitooma, Kamwenge district. He is married with four children who are all in school. Charles is a coffee farmer, where he derives most of his livelihood, and he also grows cassava for trade. This has enabled him to raise money for school fees to educate his children. He has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 to help him mulch his coffee plantation in order to get higher yields.

He is faced with a challenge of pests and diseases which attack his coffee trees, thus lowering the yields, which has affected his cash flow after he has invested in loan money. Charles is honest and hardworking. His dream is to become the best coffee farmer in the whole district of Kamwenge.

loans.use: To buy mulch.

loans.name: Giodelyn

texts.en:
Her name is Giodelyn, 27, resident of Coron, Philippines. She is married to Michael, a tricycle driver, and has two children. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to provide for her family’s daily personal and household needs.
 
Giodelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also sells direct selling products to her customers. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This will definitely boost her income as she expands her business. 

Giodelyn hopes to be able to grow her business so she could send her children to the best school. She dreams to live a happy and quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries for her general store.

loans.name: Cinyabuguma A Group

texts.fr: La cliente Aline est commerçante et présidentes de la banque communautaire Cinyabubuma A, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 36 ans, mère de 3 enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des laits frais au marché du port  depuis 13 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter 160 litress de lait. Son conjoint est un agent dans une société d’énergie électrique. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, construire une maison, acheter un véhicule, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Aline, age 36, is a merchant and the president of the Cinyabubuma A community bank. She is also a client of the Hekima MFI. Her husband works for an electrical power corporation, and she has three children who all go to school. 

She has been selling fresh milk at the harbor market for the past 13 years. She funded her activity with capital received from her husband. She plans to buy 160 liters of milk. 

Her goals are to buy some land and build a house, to buy a motor vehicle, and to feed and educate her children.  

She wishes to thank Hekima for helping entrepreneurs who do not have access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy 160 liters of milk.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 28 years old and a single mother with a three-year-old son. She lives in Livingstone where she has just completed training with Zoona to finally make her dream of running her own business come true.

Juliet will use a 5,000 ZMW loan to buy a trading booth and start a mobile money business. This will give her the opportunity to improve her and her son’s lives. She is excited and cannot wait to begin operating her own Zoona mobile money outlet. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a trading booth so that she can start running her own business

loans.name: Anavic

texts.en:
Anavic is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Carles, Iloilo. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 15 years now. This is the source of their income.

She is asking for a loan to buy more fishing gear like fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and others. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Anavic hopes to improve their fishing business and make it a success. Furthermore, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fishing gear like fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and others.

loans.name: Perise

texts.en:
Perise is 30 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling ice-cakes, taro, bananas and vegetables in her community. She has been doing this for 6 years. 

She has requested a loan to buy Chinese lollies (lollipops), a new freezer, plastic cups, etc. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Perise hopes to develop another new business and extend the business she has now.

loans.use: to buy Chinese lollies (lollipops), a new freezer, plastic cups, etc.

loans.name: Fualili

texts.en: Fualili is a 28-year-old single woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, tomatoes, beans, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Fualili has requested a loan to buy bush knives, fertilizer, vegetable seeds, a weed sprayer, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Fualili hopes to develop another business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, fertilizers, vegetable seeds, a weed sprayer, etc.

loans.name: Gala A Group

texts.fr: Kibambazi est commerçante et membre de la banque communautaire Gala A, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 52 ans, mère de 2 enfants scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu quand elle fut membre d’une tontine. Elle est vendeuse de souliers plastics dans un magasin  de la ville depuis 6 ans. Elle va acheter 500 paires de souliers. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs excluent du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Kibambazi, age 52, is a merchant and member of the Gala A community bank. She is a client of the Hekima MFI. She is the widowed mother of two children who have both received schooling. 

She has been selling plastic shoes in a local store for the past 6 years. She launched her activity with funds received from a savings group to which she used to belong. She plans to buy 500 pairs of shoes. 

She hopes to obtain additional loans in the future, and her goals are to ensure that her children are fed and educated.  

She wishes to thank Hekima for helping small entrepreneurs who do not have access to traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy 500 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Thoern's Group

texts.en:
Thoern lives in a rural village in the Moung Russey District of Battambang Province. She is a 42-year-old mother of four children. She is a rice farmer in the local area. Since she has been in the business for 11 years, she can earn a daily income of approximately KHR 25,000 and she is able to save about KHR 15,000 each day for future needs. 

This is Thoern's sixth loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used the loans from VisionFund to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve financial burdens. Now, she is seeking another loan. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. This loan will enable her to grow more healthy and fruitful rice, and she hopes to earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a door and three windows for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay enrollment fees for a conference on Economics.

loans.name: Safya

texts.en:
Safya is a 53-year-old refugee. She is married, and she has a daughter and two sons. They live in an IDP settlement. Her husband is a laborer and he works all day long in order to provide money for their family. Their main income comes from livestock. Safya breeds sheep and sells the meat and wool. 

Breeding livestock has expanded in Azerbaijan because sheep meat and wool is in high demand. People use wool to make warm coats, jackets, socks, gloves and blankets. 

Safya has been breeding sheep for 30 years and she has good skills in this area. She keeps them in a small open stall that cannot protect them from bad weather. This causes low productivity, so she applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to repair the sheep stall.

loans.use: to repair her sheep stall.

loans.name: Gala L Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Lunyere est commerçante, conseillère d’une plateforme d’affaires «Gala L», entrepreneur, âgée de 57 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants, dont 5 étudient et 4 sont déjà mariés. La cliente est vendeuse des poissons(fretins) et cliente de l’IMF Hekima. Elle installe sa marchandise dans un marché périphérique de la ville.  Elle commença ses affaires avec le capital reçu de son mari qui est sans emploi. Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 80 kg de fretins. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Our client Lunyere is  a vendor and the leader of the Gala L business group. This 57-year old entrepreneur is married and the mother of nine children, five of whom are in school and four are already married. Lunyere is a vendor of small fish and a client of Hekima. She displays her merchandise at a remote market of her town. She launched her business with the funds received from her husband, who is out of work. She has been in business for eight years. This loan will allow her to buy 80 kg [180 lbs] of small fish. In this way she would like to pay for her children’s schooling, clothing and food. Finally, she sincerely thanks Hekima for  helping female entrepreneurs who do not have access to traditional banking to become financially autonomous.

loans.use: to buy 80 kg of small fish.

loans.name: Savzkhumor

texts.ru:
Савзхумор жительница города Дангара. Ей 39 лет. Она трудолюбивая и общительная женщина. Именно поэтому она работает продавцом в своем небольшом продуктовом магазине.
Савзхумор замужем. Она мать четверых детей. У нее трое сыновей и одна дочь. Муж Савзхумор находится на заработках за рубежом. Он вынужден был поехать так как их старший сын стал студентом и прокормить семью на зарплату пришлось очень трудно. И к тому же торговля Савзхумор не шла хорошо. Сын Савзхумор учится в ВУЗ-и города Душанбе. 
Савзхумор берет кредит для покупки парфюмерии и хозяйственных товаров, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара. Она очень надеется, что ее поддержат и она сможет улучшить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Savzkhumor is a resident of the town of Dangara. She is 39 years old. She is a hardworking and sociable woman. This is precisely why she works as a salesperson at her small food market. Savzkhumor is married and has four children. She has three sons and a daughter. Savzkhumor's husband works abroad. He had to leave because their oldest son became a student, and it became very difficult to support the family with a salary. Additionally, Savzkhumor's sales were not going well. Savzkhumor's son attends a university in the city of Dushanbe. Savzkhumor is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics and household goods to expand her merchandise selection. She really hopes that she will be supported and be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and household goods to expand her merchandise selection, so that a ray of light would brighten up her home again

loans.name: Noe

texts.es: Noé de 51 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre de 84 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que todos los días sale a ganarse la vida vendiendo sandalias y calzada para dama, Noé tiene 10 años de dedicarse al negocio, por lo que sus productos son muy reconocidos por la calidad con la que cuentan, observando que sus ventas eran buenas, se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito en el pasado,  gracias al  cual logró mejorar sus ventas, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: sandalias y calzado para dama para seguir ampliando su negocio lo cual espera se vea reflejado en sus ganancias.  Noé manifiesta que se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo recibido por FUSAI  por lo que espera seguir trabajando con la institución para surtir mas sus productos.
texts.en:
Noé, age 51, lives in his own house with his 84 year old mother.  He is an enterprising man who goes out every day to earn a living selling sandals and women’s shoes.  Noé has been in this business for ten years.  Therefore, his products are very well-known for their quality.

Upon observing that his sales are good, he approached FUSAI to request a loan in the past.  Thanks to the loan, he managed to improve his sales.  Therefore, he is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to buy sandals and women’s shoes in order to continue expanding his business.  He hopes that this is reflected in his earnings.

Noé says that he is very grateful for the support received from FUSAI.  Consequently, he hopes to continue working with the institution in order to further stock his products.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en: A resident from Kampong Cham province, Horn is 46 years old and a mother of four children. She strives to make a living via rice farming and her paid working job. This business earns her about 37,000 KHR per day. Horn, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), formed a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes very much that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es: Luis de 19 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida. Él es un joven emprendedor que gracias a su esfuerzo, ha logrado posicionar su pequeña panadería en el gusto de sus clientes, en la cual distribuye pan dulce como: maría luisa, semita,  novias, quesadillas, etc. y con la cual logra sostener la economía familiar. Luis desea seguir ampliando su negocio por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: harina, azúcar, manteca, jaleas, etc.
texts.en:
Luis, age 19, lives in his own house with his life partner.  He is an enterprising young man.  Thanks to his effort, he has managed to align his small bakery to his customers’ liking.  At the bakery he sells sweet breads like “María Luisa”, “semita”, “novias”, and “quesadillas", etc.  With this he manages to support the family.

Luis wishes to continue expanding his business.  That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy flour, sugar, shortening, and jellies, etc.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, shortening, and jellies, etc.

loans.name: Melody Women Group

texts.en:
In 2014, Melody Women Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to be trained in financial management and enterprise creation. This was to help them uplift their living standards. The group members are mostly involved in farming activities.

The person raising her hand in the photograph is Salome, who is a member of the group. Salome is 33 years old. She is married and she lives with her husband. She is a dairy farmer and she sells milk in the local market. Salome applied for a loan to buy quality fodder for the cow. She hopes that quality fodder will improve milk production. This will help her meet her customers' rising demand for milk. Salome says that this loan will help increase her income, which will also improve her standard of living, because she will be able to buy good clothing and have a healthy, balanced diet.

All of the group members are happy with their loan, and they are grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy fodder.

loans.name: Arasathamman Shg - Chinnakulam Group

texts.en:
Sujatha and four other women hailing from Chinnakulam in Trichy, Tamil Nadu have formed a Self-Help Group (SHG) named Arasathamman. Forty-year-old Sujatha is a daily wage laborer, as are the other members of the group. They work long hours outside only to come back home and spend a lot of time cooking over traditional "chulha" stoves that emit a lot of smoke that is detrimental to their health. The smoke affects the children at home too. Besides, there is always the danger of contracting respiratory ailments hovering over their heads.
   
So Sujatha and her group have approached PAT, which is promoting cook stoves as part of their energy initiative with the financial support of Micrograam. The benefits of the Greenway cook stove are: fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of CO, CO2, fast and convenient cooking, high durability, and they are maintenance free and smokeless. The stove operates on all solid fuels such as wood, agro-waste, charcoal, coal and dry dung and does not require any refurbishing or recurring costs. Due to all the above reasons, these cook stoves are preferred by the group.
Sujatha and her group are, hence, seeking a loan repayable in easy installments, to buy the Greenway cook stove. Your loan will help these hardworking women to ensure better health for themselves and their families.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Iyarkkai Shg - Chinnakulam Group

texts.en:
Kalaivani (with her hand raised in the photo), 40 years old, is the leader of Iyarkkai SHG (Self Help Group), which was formed by the NGO People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. Kalaivani lives in her own house in Chinnakulam village, Trichy district, with her child and her husband. He is a small marginal farmer. Kalaivani has taken loans from PAT previously to improve her livelihood and repaid them on time. 

The fire from a traditional stove creates tangible and adverse effects including stinging eye, scratchy throats, coughs, and dirty, soot-covered walls. The smokeless stove is the solution to all of these problems, as it cooks faster and emits much less smoke. Kalaivani, along with the other members, is requesting a loan to buy a smokeless stove. They hope to save time as well as money and to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless cook stove

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es: Albertina de 41 años de edad habita en vivienda humilde pero propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 18 y 11 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 26 años, por lo que gracias a su gran experiencia y el apoyo que recibió de FUSAI logro aumentar su clientela, ya que invirtió en frutas y verduras por mayoreo, por lo que sus ganancias son mejores y logra vender más cómodo a sus clientes. Albertina desea seguir mejorando su negocio, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: güisquil, zanahoria, papas, tomates, cebollas, papaya, pepinos, etc.
texts.en: Albertina is 41 years old, she lives in a humble house that she owns with her husband and their 2 children aged 18 and 11. She is a resourceful woman who has been earning a living by selling fruits and vegetable for 26 years. Thanks to her wide experience and the support she has receive by FUSAI she has succeeded in increasing the number of her customers: she invested in fruits and vegetable at wholesale price and now her earnings have improved and she succeeds in selling in more comfortable way to her customers. Albertina wants to keep on improving her activity, and for this reason she is requesting a new loan to FUSAI to invest it in: chayote (pear squash), carrots, potatoes, tomatoes onions, papaya and cucumbers.

loans.use: To buy chayote (pear squash), carrots, potatoes, tomatoes onions, papaya and cucumbers.

loans.name: Azamat

texts.ru:
Азамат 47 лет. Она замужем за трудового мигранта. Ее муж уже несколько лет ездит в Россию на заработки, поэтому воспитанием детей всецело занималась Азамат. У нее четверо детей, все они уже совершеннолетние. Азамат со своей семьей живет в столице, в городе Душанбе. На протяжении 5 лет Азамат работает на швейной фабрике. Она любит свою профессию и с интересом выполняет свою работу. 
Азмат сейчас хочет улучшить бытовые условия в доме. Целью ее кредита является покупка бытовой техники. Она надеется, что получит поддержку с Вашей стороны и реализует свою мечту.
texts.en: Azamat is 47 years old. She is married to a migrant worker. Her husband has been going to Russia for work for several years, and Azamat has been solely responsible for the children's upbringing. She has four children, all of whom are of age now. Azamat and her family live in the capital city of Dushanbe. Azamat has been working at a sewing factory for 5 years. She loves her work and does it with great interest. Azamat now wants to improve her living conditions at home. The goal of the loan is to purchase household appliances. She hopes that she will receive Your support and realize her dream.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To change the roof of his house and to buy cement, sand, purlins, piedrín (a type of building stone) and zinc sheets.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena lives in Suai. She is married and she has five children. She is selling clothes because most of her daily income is from selling clothes and her husband is a driver. 

She is applying for a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a place in the market so she is selling every day. Many people are interested in her clothes so they come to buy her clothes. She started to do this business in 2010 with her own working capital of $1,125.00. 

She is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants used to buy more clothes such as T-shirts, trousers, shorts, children's clothes, and other things to sell. And with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy T-shirts, trousers, shorts, children's clothes, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Everelean

texts.en:
Everelean (pictured right) is a widowed, single woman who has struggled to support herself as well as her disabled son. Everelean’s husband passed away just a week before the couple was to close on their new home. Although Everelean has reached retirement age, she has had to work additional hours to meet her financial commitments as well as provide for her son, Albert (pictured left), who is financially and emotionally dependent on her. Everelean’s main goal is to provide a safe and comfortable living environment for her son. She used the small amount of insurance money she received from her husband’s passing to handle his final expenses and to complete some of the greatly needed repairs to her home. Ultimately, Everelean did not have enough money to pay for the replacement of her jalousie windows, which are original to her home that was built in 1958. 

Everelean will use her KIVA loan to install new windows which will improve the safety and comfort of her family, as well as reduce the energy consumption of her home.

loans.use: to help Everelean pay for new windows for her home.

loans.name: Potoae

texts.en:
Potoae is a 52-year-old woman who is married with three children. She runs a business sewing and selling clothes in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Potoae has requested a loan to buy materials, thread, scissors, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family as well. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to  buy materials, thread, scissors, needles, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra de 37 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que todos los días se esfuerza por llevar el pan de cada día a sus hijos, de los cuales tiene que responsabilizarse completamente ante la ausencia del padre, es por ello  que buscando la manera de ganarse la vida y poder estar pendiente de ellos, para lo que se desempeña como vendedora de sandalias y zapatos de mujer, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años de forma ambulante. Sandra ha observado que sus ventas son muy buenas y cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus productos por lo que no alcanza a cubrir todos los pedidos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: zapatos y sandalias para mujer.
texts.en: Sandra is 37 years old, she is a single mother and she lives in a house of her own with her 2 children aged 12 and 9. She is a resourceful woman who makes efforts every day to provide food to her children, of whom she has the complete care because their father is absent. For this reason, she looks for ways to earn a living and to care for her children, and she sells sandals and shoes for women, an activity she has been engaged in for 5 years as a street vendor. Sandra has noticed that her sales are very good, and as more customers ask for her products every day and she cannot meet everybody’s requests she is asking for a loan to FUSAI in order to invest in shoes an sandals for women.

loans.use: To buy shoes and sandals for women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, chicken, meat, cereal, pastries, amongst others.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia tuvo un matrimonio difícil, hoy en día es madre soltera con muchos esfuerzos está apoyando a sus hijos a que estudien, una de sus hijas está estudiando medicina lo cual es una gran alegría para ella, las apoya con los gastos  gracias a su empleo como mesera, María Eugenia con el crédito anterior pudo realizar mejoras en su vivienda, hizo el muro perimetral, ahora con este crédito necesita hacer el baño con todas las condiciones sanitarias necesarias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Eugenia had a difficult marriage and today she is a single mother who is putting a lot of effort into supporting her children, who are in school.  One of her daughters is studying medicine, which makes her very happy.  She helps with their expenses thanks to her job as a waitress.  María Eugenia was able to improve her home with her last loan; she put up a perimeter wall.  Now with this loan she needs to fit the bathroom with all the sanitary conditions necessary to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, rebar, and sheet metal.

loans.name: Labyrenth

texts.en: Labyrenth is a married 24-year-old mother who helped her husband working in their own farm to make a living. She grows vegetables while her husband manages their farm and sells their products in the market. They learned that organic farming had a positive impact on their farm that gives better harvest in return. With this, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizers and animal manure to increase crop yields and to replace soil nutrients. In the future, Labyrenth wants to renovate their house and to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and animal manure to increase crop yields and to replace soil nutrients

loans.name: Donozio

texts.en:
Donozio is a 52-year-old from a village in Ruhunga Kamwenge district. A married father of six children, three of whom are in school, Donozio is a farmer who brews alcohol to support his family. He also raises goats to supplement his income. 

Donozio has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to help him buy a milling machine for millet and cassava to earn additional income. Currently, his  neighbors must travel long distances to have their millet and cassava milled.

A very hardworking and honest man, Donozio's dream is to build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: To buy a milling machine

loans.name: Zulfiqar Ahmed

texts.en:
Zulfiqar Ahmed is a 43-year-old energetic young man living with his family in the area of Gujrat, Pakistan. He has been running a dairy farm for fifteen years and generating income for his family. He sells milk to retailers and to the people of his community. He gets milk two times in day, and his wife and daughters produce cheese, yogurt, and butter from the milk. With the addition of these productions he earns sufficient income to run a house. 

At this time he wants to build a new cowshed for cattle because the old cowshed is in very poor condition. He does not have enough cash in hand to maintain the cowshed and fodder to feed his cattle. 

Therefore, Zulfiqar Ahmed requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he can build up the cowshed and can easily continue his business. He has to maximize his savings so that he could easily fulfill his responsibilities. He thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cows and buffaloes for his dairy farm

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a young 21-year-old businesswoman. She resides in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Leaner Guide. Learner Guides volunteer 2.5 hours each week at a local school teaching students life and study skills. She is also a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. She encourages young people to maintain their wellbeing and support others’ wellbeing. 

She has been selling kapenta (dried sardines) since May 2014 and is looking to expand her business. With the Kiva loan she intends to purchase more kapenta so as to increase her stock. With additional profits she would like to further her education and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more kapenta to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive en compañia de su hermana mayor en la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja cuidando personas delicadas y de la tercera edad.
Ana  necesita el crédito para continuar con los arreglos en la habitacion que hizo construir anteriormente donde tiene una porcion de terreno recibida por herencia y que esto sea el comienzo de tener una casita propia. 
Ana no tiene a nadie que le ayude, su hermana mayor tiene sus propios gastos por eso ella acudio a Kiva
texts.en:
Ana is single, has no children, and lives in the company of her older sister in the city of La Paz.  She works caring for elderly people in poor health.  

Ana needs this loan to continue with repairs to the room she built previously on a plot of land that she received from an inheritance and which will be the beginnings of having her own home.  

Ana does not have anyone to help her; her older sister has her own expenses, which is why she came to Kiva.

loans.use: to continue with repairs to the room she built

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee de 58 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 23 y 28 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que todos los días sale a ganarse la vida con su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y comida, actividad que realiza desde hace 7 años, por lo que gracias a su experiencia y el apoyo que obtuvo de FUSAI con el cerdito anterior logró aumentar su clientela, ya que invirtió en mercadería por mayoreo, por lo que se siente muy agradecida con la institución. Haydee desea seguir mejorando su negocio por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ropa como faldas, blusas, camisas, pantalones, calcetines, comida, etc. Haydee se siente muy agradecida con el apoyo proporcionado con FUSAI, ya que gracias a ello logró mejorar sus ventas y adquirió mercadería por mayor logrando mejorar sus precios al igual que sus ventas.
texts.en: Haydee is 58 years old, she lives in a house of her own with her husband and their 2 children aged 23 and 28. She is a resourceful woman who earns her living every day thanks to her small shop where she sells clothes and food. She has been engaging in  his activity for 7 years, and thanks to her experience and the support she has received from FUSAI with her previous loan she succeeded in increasing the number of her customers, as she invested in buying products sat wholesale price, and she is deeply grateful to this institution. Haydee wants to keep on improving her activity and for this reason she in requesting a loan to FUSAI in order to invest it in the purchase of clothes such as skirts, blouses, shirts, trousers, socks and in food. Haydee feels deeply grateful for the support granted by FUSAI, as thanks to his she has succeeded in improving her sales and she has been able to buy products at wholesale prices, thus improving her prices as well as her sales.

loans.use: To buy skirts, blouses, shirts, trousers, socks and food.

loans.name: Camino De Jesus Group

texts.es:
LEIDY mujer de 30 años y tiene 3 hijos. ahora esta viviendo en San Lorenzo - luego de haber tenido que vivir muy asustada en Colombia por la situación de la violencia. 
En Ecuador ha logrado tener amistades y sus hijos asisten a la escuela- LEIDY ha puesto todos sus deseos de progresar en este pais a través de la venta de pescado actividad que viene realizando en baja escala por lo que no cuenta con los recursos económicos.
ella con esta oportunidad de prestamo, comprará pescado fresco para venderlo en el mercado y poder t 
Ahora participa de este grupo en FODEMI donde está segura que va a poder trabajar para pagar las necesidades de alimentación y salud de sus hijos.
LEIDY esta motivada en continuar con sus estudios- se siente muy contenta con que sus hijos ahora pueden jugar en un ambiente sano.
ella forma parte de este grupo ya que se ha ganado el cariño y aprecio de sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Leidy is a 30-year old woman with three children. Frightened by the violence in Columbia where she used to live, she now lives in San Lorenzo. In Ecuador she has managed to make friends and her children attend school. All her efforts are now focussed on doing well in this country. She earns her living selling fish on a small scale as she does not have the financial resources to do otherwise.

With this loan Leidy will purchase fresh fish to sell in the market place in order to pay for household expenses. 

Now she has joined the Fodemi group and feels more secure. She knows that she is going to be able to work to pay for her children’s food and health needs. Leidy also wishes to continue with her studies. She is happy that her children can now play in a safe environment. She herself is happy that she is part of this group and has gained the affection and appreciation of her neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to sell it in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a lot of pigs.

loans.name: Robert Edson

texts.es:
Robert es un hombre joven de 23 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es una tienda de barrio.
Él es emprendedor, inteligente, dedicado, tolerante, comprensivo, responsable y muy tranajador. Su negocio es la atención de una tienda de barrio en la zona de Chijini, lugar caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas.
Robert es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el aymara porque es parte de sus raíces, él se dedica a la atención de una tienda de barrio, actividad que comparte con estudios de contabilidad a nivel técnico. Su sueño es terminar su carrera técnica satisfactoriamente y trabajar de manera correcta en cualquier empresa.
Es por esos motivos que Robert solicita un préstamo para la compra de una laptop y contar con un instrumento para poder terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Robert, 23, is a single young man with no children.  His business is a neighborhood store.

He's enterprising, intelligent, dedicated, tolerant, understanding, responsible, and very hardworking.  His business is tending a neighborhood store in the Chijini area, known for all types of commerce.

Robert is of medium build and has a dark complexion and short black hair.  His native language is Spanish and he knows Aymara because it's part of his heritage.  He earns a living tending a neighborhood store, a job he carries out alongside his university studies in accounting.  His dream is to finish his program satisfactorily and work in an appropriate position in some company.

For these reasons Robert's requesting a loan to buy a laptop so he has a tool for completing his studies.

loans.use: to buy a laptop so he can complete his studies.

loans.name: Taofi

texts.en: Taofi is 42 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling donuts and cream buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc. In the future, Taofi hopes to earn money to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 37 years old, is in a relationship, and lives in her own home with her husband and 3 children. She has a close family. She lives in a community that specializes in business, agriculture, and livestock farming. Her community is located in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Perú.

Vilma raises and sells animals and also has a motorcycle taxi that she rents out to be used as means of public transportation for the urban and rural areas. Before, the mototaxi was run by her husband, but now he works in agriculture. 

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more animals to increase and diversify her stock. She wants to meet all of the unmet demands of her community and attract more customers to receive higher revenues and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to diversify her stock and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for 10 years and repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income through her food vending business.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 51,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with thankfulness in her heart.

In the future, Julia wants her business to grow bigger. She desires that her family will always be healthy and happy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Roja Shg - Chinnakulam Group

texts.en:
Ganajothi (pictured with her hand raised) is the leader of the Roja Shg (Self-Help Group), which is managed by the local NGO People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India.   

Ganajothi hails from Chinnakulam village, Trichy district. She lives in her own house with her child and husband. Her husband is a small, marginal farmer who works for daily wages.

Ganajothi wants to purchase a smokeless stove because it uses less wood and hardly emits any smoke. This means less carbon dioxide and it saves time and labor. The traditional stove emits a lot of smoke and it leads to air pollution, deforestation etc.

The other members of the group are also requesting a loan to purchase smokeless stoves to have a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless cookstove

loans.name: Petronella

texts.en:
Petronella is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in the Mbire District of Zimbabwe. She is a devoted entrepreneur who inspires other young ladies through her work as the owner of goat-keeping business which has been successfully running for the past six months at her home. She started the business with three goats that she got from her parents. She is very happy with the progress she has made so far, breeding and selling nearly ten goats per month. Petronella is also a Learner Guide at the local secondary school where she teaches life skills to students.

With the requested Kiva loan, Petronella will make bulk purchases of vaccines for her goats. She also wants to buy female goats so that she continues to expand her herd. This will enable her to make great profits and expand into rearing cattle.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of vaccines for her goats as well as buying female goats to expand her herd.

loans.name: Irfan Shah

texts.en:
Irfan Shah is 34 years old and lives in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is the father of two children and the sole earner of the family. 

He provides local, rural transportation in the form of a tractor to the people of his community. He has been running the tractor as both a loader and cargo transport. He has had his own tractor for the last 10 years. Due to excessive and continuous use, it needs some maintenance. So Irfan Shah has decided to repair his tractor as soon as possible. But due to the lack of financial means, Irfan Shah finds it difficult to cover the cost to repair his tractor. Therefore, Irfan Shah has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help him to cover the cost to repair his tractor. 

Irfan Shah is thankful to both Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing his tractor.

loans.name: Auomala

texts.en:
Auomala is 46 years old and married with seven children. She has a small plantation where she grows produce including cabbages, cucumbers and beans.  She has been doing this for three years. Auomala has requested a loan to buy products to support her farming efforts including chemicals, a wheelbarrow, seeds and a shovel. 

She joined SPBD in 2011 in order to gain access to capital. Auomala will save her earnings to expand her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, seeds, a shovel, etc.

loans.name: Francis Miguel

texts.es:
Francis es un joven emprendedor de 21 años, con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia, vive en Ica junto a su familia. Desde hace varios años trabaja como Obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola y cree que le está yendo bien porque es muy trabajador, responsable y labora por más de 10 horas al día para obtener más ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Francis está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una refrigeradora para su casa, así sus comidas estarán en mejor estado por más tiempo y gozarán de buena salud. Así Francis seguirá luchando por el bienestar de su familia, para que puedan tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Francis is a young, 21-year-old entrepreneur who really wants to get ahead for his family.  He lives in Ica with his family.  For several years, he has worked as a field laborer at a farm and he thinks it is going well for him because he is very hardworking and responsible and he works for over 10 hours a day to make more income and improve his family's quality of life.  

Francis is thankful to Kiva's lenders because with the support they have offered him he will be able to buy a refrigerator for his home, which will keep his food in better shape for longer and will improve their health.  Francis will keep working for his family's wellbeing so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator so his food will last longer.

loans.name: Avegel

texts.en: Avegel is a 23-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Carles, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than four years, and it is their main source of income. Avegel is in need of additional capital for their business. She is asking for a loan to buy more fishing nets, lead weights and a new boat engine. This will enable her husband to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Avegel hopes to make her business a success. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets, lead weights and a new boat engine

loans.name: Sonia Hayde

texts.es:
La Joven Sonia tiene 30 años de edad, actualmente vive en Tegucigalpa en compañía de sus padres.
Sonia se considera una persona productiva, con deseos de superarse en la vida cotidiana de tal manera creativa y receptiva para poner en practica lo que aprende.
La motivación de Sonia  es poder alcanzar sus metas personales, como su maestría y a la vez crecer en el ámbito profesional para lograr colocarse en entornos competitivos. 
Sonia desea apoyar de una mejor manera la economía de sus padres ya que desde que ella ha trabajado les ha brindado incondicionalmente su ayuda económica.
Como aprendizaje a lo largo de su vida, agradece a sus padres por darle siempre el apoyo en sus estudios, reconoce que sus padres se han ganado la vida a base de sacrificios y que son el mejor ejemplo a seguir ya que a pesar de que ellos no tuvieron la oportunidad de estudiar, siempre se esmeraron por darle lo mejor.
Sus planes a mediano plazo es el de obtener un capital semilla que le pueda cambiar su vida logrando ser una empresaria exitosa.
texts.en:
Sonia is a young woman of 30 who currently lives in Tegucigalpa with her parents. 

Sonia considers herself to be a productive person who wants to better herself in daily life in a creative way that allows her to put what she learns into practice.  

Sonia's motivation is to be able to reach her personal goals, such as her master's, while at the same time growing in her professional field so she can position herself in competitive environments.  

Sonia wants to support her parents financially in a better way, as since she has been working she has offered them her unconditional financial support.  

As a lifelong learner, she thanks her parents for always supporting her in her education.  She recognizes that her parents have earned their living through sacrifice and that they are the best example to follow, as despite the fact that they were not able to get an education, they always took great pains to give her the best.  

Her mid-term plans are to get seed money that will allow her to change her life by becoming a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to pursue her master's degree

loans.name: Narann

texts.en: Narann, a local resident from Kampong Speu province, is 48 years old and a mother of five children. She does rice cropping as a sole source of income to support her family. This is Narann's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She wants to focus on her son's education. Therefore, she has applied for a new loan in order to pay tuition fees for her son, who is pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree majoring in Law. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her son who is majoring in law.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Macoura

texts.fr: Monsieur MACOURA est un homme qui habite à un autre quartier que celui du guichet. Il es marié et père de famille et gère tous les charges quotidiennes de la famille. Il évolue dans le transport et voudrait ce crédit pour acheter un moteur pour sa voiture.Il a une expérience de plus 15 ans dans cette activité et démarre sa journée à 8h 30mn pour la terminer à 17h. Il voudrait augmenter ses revenus et acquérir d'un autre véhicule de transport. Ainsi il pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et épargner de l'argent
texts.en:
Mr. MACOURA lives in a different district than the UIMCEC branch. He is married with children, and he is responsible for all of his household’s day-to-day expenses. 

He works in transportation, and he is seeking this loan to buy a new engine for his car. He has over 15 years of experience in his activity, and he works from 8:30 a.m. until 7 p.m. 

He wants to bolster his revenue and purchase another transportation vehicle. This would allow him to improve his family’s living conditions and to save some money.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for a vehicle that broke down.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for building new greenhouses on the family farm.

loans.name: Uigi

texts.en: Uigi, 30 years old, is married and has one child. For the past 2 years, she has run a small business selling BBQ in her community. Uigi has requested a loan to buy oil, tomato sauce, shopping bags, plastic cups, chicken legs, sausages, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. Uigi will save her profit for her child's education and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy tomato sauce, soy sauce, oil, chicken legs, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula de 45 años de edad,  debido a que su familia era de escasos recursos, solo estudio hasta 3º grado, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos. 

Paula es comerciante desde los 10 años, su principal fuente de ingresos es la venta diaria ambulante de  verduras y frutas, pero  también en su casa cría  animales domésticos como cerdos y aves de corral para luego venderlos. En estos momentos su fuerte es el comercio de sandía y la siembra de granos básicos, debido a que es la temporada.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes, plaguicidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra para preparar el terreno de siembra.

Paula espera que con su negocio mejoren sus condiciones de vida, mejorar su casa y vivir cómoda y segura con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paula is 45 years old; because her family had few resources, she only has a third-grade education; she is single and has three children.  

Paula has been a merchant for 10 years; her primary source of income is her daily on-foot sales of fruits and vegetables, but she also raises domestic animals in her home for sale, such as pigs and birds.  Currently, she is focusing on selling watermelons and growing staple grains because of the season.  

This loan will be used to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides, and to pay for labor to prepare the land for planting.  

Paula hopes that, with her business, her living conditions will improve, she will improve her home, and she will live comfortably and safely with her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides, and to pay for labor to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina tiene 53 años de edad y habita junto a su esposo y un hijo quien ya es mayor de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para apoyar en la economía de la familia. Evangelina se dedica a la venta de bolsas de tela los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante. Este negocio le permite percibir ingresos para el apoyo de su familia. Evangelina solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para construir una pared de la vivienda dado que se encuentra en mal estado. Expresa estar muy agradecida por el apoyo recibido en el pasado.
texts.en: Evangelina is 53 years old and lives with her husband and one son, who is an adult.  She is an enterprising woman who does everything at her availability to support her family financially.  Evangelina sells cloth bags on foot for a living.  This business allows her to generate income to support her family.  Evangelina is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in sheet metal and wool to build a wall for her home because it is currently in bad shape.  She tells us that she is very thankful for the support she has received in the past.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and wood to build a wall for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for the winter season to stock her business.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Chhnang province, Savy is 41 years old and a mother of two children. She earns income to support her family by selling grocery items and catching fish. Moreover, she can earn extra income by making wine for sale and pig farming. 

This is Savy's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes it will provide her house with electricity to use.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Kampong Leng District

loans.name: Leleth

texts.en:
Leleth is 22 years old.  She is the mother of two children and settled in Misamis Occidental to live with her family. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him, working on the farm in order to improve their situation. She joined GDMPC and has taken out a loan in order to buy additional materials and manure fertilizer to support planting and growing bananas. 

She wants to improve her entire family’s general living situation.

loans.use: to buy materials and manure fertilizer to support planting and growing bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more kapenta to sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Carles, Iloilo. She is engaged in food vending business to the people in her area. She sells home cooked snack foods, as well as bread and biscuits. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a fisherman.

Doris is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, cooking oil, and additional stocks to sell like soda, bread, and biscuits. Through this loan, she will be able to cook and sell more food to her customers. 

Doris dreams of expanding her business and makes it a sustainable source of income. She adds that she wants to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food vending and additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Aone

texts.en:
Aone is 41 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling fruits and vegetables in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. 

Aone has requested a loan to buy weed sprayer, bush knives, chemicals, shovel, wheelbarrow, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Aone will save the profit to support her family and extend her business.

loans.use: to buy weed sprayer, bush knives, chemicals, shovel, wheelbarrow, etc

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Kampong Speu province, Sokhom is 50 years old. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school, the other two are too young. She struggles to make a living via rice cropping on a two hectare area. She earns about 20,000 KHR per day. 

For Sokhom, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is a group leader of a group of four members. She will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine to improve her living. She hopes that she can improve her family standard of living and health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été  depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois et il est composé  de femmes issues du même village et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
La responsable madame Awa âgée de 48 ans  est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont un garçon et deux filles tous scolarisés.
Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de poissons frais et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans c e domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.
Son nouveau crédit de 500000 francs lui permettra de se payer des caisses de poissons et des sacs de légumes qu'elle va revendre au niveau de son quartier au détails.
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires sanitaires et scolaires de ses enfants .
texts.en:
This group has been around since the very first loan cycle of the Banc Villageois, and it consists of women from the same village who share a strong social and professional bond. 

Mrs. Awa, age 48, is the head of the group. She is married with three children, one boy and two girls, who all go to school. 

She runs a commercial activity selling fresh fish. She has a good command of this work, having practiced this activity for a long time. 

This new loan of 500,000 francs will allow her to purchase crates of fish and bags of vegetables to retail in her village. 

The profits earned help her to look after her children’s needs with respect to food, healthcare and education.

loans.use: to buy crates of fish.

loans.name: Senghun

texts.en:
Senghun is a 31-year-old, married woman. She has two dependent children. She lives in a small village in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to local dealers. So far, she has been in this career for six years; the average income is USD 6.00 a day.

Senghun wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use. There is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is taking a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Rika

texts.en:
Rika and her family live in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Her husband is a lower-management level employee in a private company. As a housewife, Rika helps contribute to the family income by running a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime. 

Rika joined Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to try the mobile airtime business. She is very excited to expand her business by adding mobile phone airtime credits to the things she sells. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more transactions in her community in the weekends. In the photo, Rika is in her small stall. Rika thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
This is Judith. She is 52 years old, married, and blessed with four children. 

Judith practices poultry keeping. She is applying for a loan to purchase feeds for her poultry. She hopes this will help improve their productivity to meet the rising demand for eggs and chicken. This will improve her income to be in a position to meet her family needs, such as food and education.

Judith is happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Carles, Iloilo. She has been engaged in the fishing business for more than 27 years now. It is the source of her income.

Elsie is asking for a loan to buy fish net and engine. With this loan, her fishing business will improve thus generating more income. Elsie dreams of making her business more productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fish net and engine

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti and her family live in the northern part of Bogor regency, located at the south border of Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Siti and her husband have three children. As a source of income, Siti runs a small fashion store selling sunglasses and mobile phone airtime. 

She joined Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to increase her income. She is now very excited because she has more friends, Ruma staffs, who she can learn from and help her improve her store. Siti hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more mobile transactions in her community in the weekends. 

In the photo, Siti is in her small store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community

loans.name: Marilin Abigail

texts.es: Marilin de 22 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar constituido por: una tía, un primo, un sobrino y sus 4 hermanas. Ella es una joven responsable que se gana la vida elaborando pan en una panadería familiar, además buscando tener ingresos extra venden gas propano y es gracias a dichos negocios que logra sostener la economía familiar al lado de sus familiares. Marilin habita con un grupo familiar extenso por lo que desea construir un cuarto dormitorio para tener un lugar adecuado para vivir, pero al no contar con los recursos económicos necesarios, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, arena, cemento, grava y hierro para construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marilin is 22 years old and lives in her own house together with her family, consisting of: an aunt, a cousin, a nephew, and her 4 sisters.  She is a responsible young woman who earns a living baking bread in a family-owned bakery.  She also sells propane gas in order to earn extra money.  It is thanks to these businesses that she is able to sustain the family financially, alongside her family members.

She lives with her extended family, which is why she would like to build a bedroom in order to have a suitable place to live, but does not have the money she needs to do so.  

She is requesting a loan through FUSAI in order to purchase bricks, sand, cement, gravel, and metal to build a bedroom in her home.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, sand, cement, gravel, and metal in order to build a bedroom in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in windows, floor tile, cement, and sand

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a 25-year-old businesswoman who is married with one child. She resides in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe where she is currently working as a Camfed Learner Guide, providing life skills to students at her local secondary school. 

She is also a businesswoman who sells clothes, jewelry, and groceries; like soap, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and sweets to her local community. She has been doing this business for over nine months and would love to see it expand. With the Kiva loan, she wishes to purchase more products like clothes, jewelry, and groceries; like soap, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and sweets. 

She wishes to use the profits of her business to pay fees for her two younger sisters.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is married, she has four children, and her husband is in agriculture. She has been involved in business activities since 2008 when she started with her own working capital of $50.00. 

Juliana has a kiosk in her house and she also sells in the market. With the business she is doing every day, she decided to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital. With the loan, she will buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including toothpaste, candles, cooking oil, slippers, candy, instant noodles, sugar and other things to sell including hard drinks and soft drinks. So now she is requesting a loan of $600 (USD) to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, candles, cooking oil, slippers, candy, instant noodles, sugar and other things to sell including hard drinks and soft drinks

loans.name: Daniansyah

texts.en:
Meet Daniansyah, who lives with his family in East Bandung, a regency area located in West Java province. Daniansyah (also called Dani) is a micro-entrepreneur who runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, other consumer daily products, and mobile phone airtime. He was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma staff member who visited his stall, and he subsequently joined Ruma about a month ago. 

As his phone business continues to grow, Daniansyah hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more mobile services for his community on the weekends. He plans to save the resulting extra income for his child’s education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Canaan Ogilgei Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Helen. She is a member of Canaan Ogilgei Women Group in Nakuru Kenya. Helen is sixty-two years old, married and blessed with seven children.
 
Helen sells second hand clothes in the local market, she also hawks in the neighbourhood to reach more customers. Helen is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for inculcating an entrepreneurial spirit in her through the training. She is borrowing from Kiva to expand her clothing enterprise by adding more stock. She hopes that this will enable her to meet the rising demand for clothing and increase her income. This will help her to expand her business and also to support her family needs such as food and education.

Hellen is happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothes.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Meet Ahmad. Ahmad and his six family members live in West Bandung, a regency area located in West Java province. Ahmad is a micro-entrepreneur who runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime. He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall and he quickly became interested to join Ruma about a month ago. Ahmad believes that using technology will make the business run easier. He also seeks more business opportunities in the future. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him processing more mobile services to his community on the weekends. 

Ahmad is pictured in the photo standing in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new computers for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Sarfraz

texts.en: Sarfraz is age 28, living in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a farmer by profession and owner of large areas of cultivation land. He cultivates seasonal crops on his land. Mostly he likes to cultivate rice crops. In his land area, there is no canal system for watering.  Rice crops needs much water for irrigation purposes, so he has to arrange another source for his crops irrigation. Now he has decided to irrigate his land by a tube well system. He wants the irrigation by tube well, because this rainy season has not been effective for water requirements of the rice crops. For this purpose he has to bear some additional amounts. Therefore, Sarfraz has requested for a loan from KIVA’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Sarfraz is very thankful to Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost for irrigation by tube well for his rice crop.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en: Nimfa is married and is living in Misamis Occidental with her family. This village is an agricultural area suitable for farming. She works as a farmer growing and selling her farm products in the market in town. Her dream is to improve her quality of life and that of her child. She thinks with the use of fertilizers, livestock manure and herbicides she will generate a better income. She also needs to make a few farm improvements for sustainable benefits for producing and the environment.  For these reasons, Nimfa is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer and banana planting materials. She wants to renovate her house with the profits.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and banana planting materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of 11 children from Carles, Iloilo. She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than 30 years.
 
Gemma is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. This purchase will improve their daily catch, which means they can sell more fish to the market. Gemma hopes to expand their fishing business and make it more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Ongemuiten Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Lily. She is a member of the Ongemuiten Women Group. She is 32 years old, married, and blessed with three children.

She does poultry keeping.  She is borrowing a loan to add more chickens and to buy chicken feed.  She hopes this will assist in increasing the egg production and will help in meeting the rising demand for eggs and chickens, thus leading to increased income. This will help her support her family needs such as food and education. She is happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for this help and support.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and more chickens.

loans.name: Erik

texts.en: Erik and his four family members live in Sukabumi, a city located about 106 km from Jakarta. Erik is a micro-entrepreneur who runs a small shop that sells mobile phones, accessories and airtime, and processes utility bill payments for his customers. He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall, and Erik quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago. As the manager of his own business, Erik believes that using technology will make the business run more easily. Now that the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more bill payments and provide mobile services to his community on the weekends. Erik is pictured in the photo standing in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To provide bill payment and mobile services in his community

loans.name: Sahila

texts.en:
Sahila is a 34-year-old divorced woman who has a son and two daughters. They all live with Sahila’s father in an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) settlement. The family's only source of income is gardening and Sahila works very hard at this. She has been growing seasonal fruits such as pomegranates, apples and peaches for 9 years. Her children help her and then she supplies the harvest to groceries. She is very experienced but her monthly income is only 150 AZN.

Gardening is much expanded in Azerbaijan. People buy fresh seasonal fruits and use them for making fresh juice, fruit pies and jam for the winter. Sahila loves her job and she works without rest. Her children support her in everything and she wants to provide them with a good and happy life. Sahila has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy a place at the local bazaar so she will not have to pay rent every month. This will save money and cover the family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy a place at the local bazaar

loans.name: Sajjad Ahmed

texts.en: Sajjad Ahmed is a 32-year-old married man, living in the area of Gujrat, Pakistan. He is the father of three children. He is a shoemaker and very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing shoes for the last ten years.  He sews leather and rexine shoes by machine, and after that attaches the soles through stitching by his hands. In this way he is getting income for his family. He has been making shoes at home, and now he wants to increase his business on a wide level. He does not have an amount to buy initial raw materials for making shoes. Therefore, Sajjad Ahmed has requested a loan so that he can buy initial raw materials for making shoes. This will help him to continue his business. Sajjad Ahmed is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Hysen

texts.en: Hysen wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which helped him to renovate his toilet. He is still living in a Roma community in poor and substandard conditions. He is still collects iron and plastic bags to earn a living. He is very satisfied with the first loan because he was able to improve the toilet conditions. He is again requesting a loan in order to renovate his house, this time to give his family some better living conditions. He is very grateful for the support and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate his house to give his family better living conditions.

loans.name: Nur Hamid

texts.en:
Meet Nur Hamid. 

He lives together with his five family members in Magelang, a city in Central Java province in Indonesia that is famous for its 9th century Buddhist temple of Borobudur. 

Nur Hamid is single and he currently works at a private company to support his family. He began working with Ruma about a month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He is planning to allocate the extra money to start seeking more business opportunities.

As the mobile airtime business continues to run, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more mobile and bill payment services in his community on the weekends. Nur Hamid is pictured in the photo standing in front of his family house. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile and bill payment services in his community on the weekends

loans.name: Amukeni Tabot Bee Keeping Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Joseph, a member of the Amukeni Tabot Bee Keeping Self Help Group. He is 53 years old, married and living with his wife and six children. Joseph does maize, beans and potato farming. Having gone through enterprise training provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he is now able to manage his farming business as well as maintaining clear and correct records. He is borrowing a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and planting seeds to boost his farming activities. He looks forward to a bounty harvest that will ensure maintenance of consistent supplies to the market. Joseph looks forward to increased income, as this will enable him to pay his children’s school fees with ease.  

He is grateful and happy for Kiva and their lenders for the support and he promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase planting seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gjyla

texts.en:
Gjyla is 38 years old and the mother of 4 children. She lives in the southern part of Kosovo. Gjyla is a housewife and her husband works in a bakery for a low salary, which is the main source of income for her family. They have never had an opportunity to improve their living conditions because Gjyla's husband's income is too low to meet their daily needs and put money into savings or other investments.
