Gjyla is requesting a loan in order to replace the doors in the house. This will be very beneficial to complete before the upcoming winter season, helping to keep the house insulated, warmer and dry. She hopes, in the future, to find some employment so that she can save and give her children a better education.

loans.use: To replace the doors and renovate the house

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex, who is in his early 30’s, is single with two small kids.  He has been a tailor since 2006.  He works from 7a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Alex's 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used he previous loans to buy materials and sewing equipment for making ladies’ dresses, men’s suits, and orders for school uniforms. He is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support. He has successfully paid back all of his loans.  He used the profits to buy a land, takes care of his family, and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to start operating a barbershop. Alex will take care of his loan and will be accountable to pay it back.

loans.use: to start operating a barbershop.

loans.name: Ma. Aileen

texts.en:
Ma. Aileen is married and a mother, and has for the last seven years earned an income by running a variety store where customers buy inexpensive items such as shampoo, cooking oil, or an egg. She gets her supplies at wholesale prices and sells them at retail. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of PhP 1,000 in sales every day.

She wants to make her business more profitable by taking out a loan for PHP 25,000 to buy more items to sell. Her goal is to earn more money so she can give her children the best possible education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather weekly to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Abdul Razaq

texts.en:
Abdul Razaq, 40 years old, is married and has three children. He lives in Gujrat, Pakistan, along with his family. Abdul Razaq is the sole earner and responsible for financially supporting his family. 

For the past 15 years, Abdul Razaq has operated a poultry business, selling eggs to shopkeepers at wholesale rates. He has become famous for providing good-quality poultry products in his locality. The income generated by his present flock is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so Abdul Razaq wants to increase his business. He has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, which will help him to increase his sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for him. Abdul Razaq thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase his egg sales business

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 58 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with five children. She does poultry farming and has been in this business for 15 years now. She also sells bananas and it has been profitable.

This is Pauline's second loan and she plans to use it to buy more poultry for rearing. This will enable her to supply more chickens and eggs and make more income, which she will use to expand her business.

She has paid back her previous loan successfully and in the future she hopes to grow her business and open poultry shops and also be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more poultry for rearing.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 27 years old and lives in Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is a responsible father of two children. He owns a farm, growing fruit trees and selling the farm produce in the market. In addition to his produce, he buys more fruit like lansones from their neighboring villages and sells it in volume in town.

He is the sole earner in his family so he wants to increase his income. In this way, he will be able to meet his family's needs. Now he wants to buy more fruit like lansones (langsat) to sell and is requesting a loan from GDMPC Micro finance. He wants to become successful in his business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit like lansones (langsat) for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 19,500 from NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her business. Josephine successfully repaid her previous loan and is requesting a new one to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Josephine's business profile to support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 36-year-old Susan from Chitungwiza. She is married with four children, two of whom are attending school.  Susan runs an agriculture business raising chickens. The business has been in operation for 1 year and 4 months. She says the main challenge faced is failing to meet demand due to low production capacity. Susan has requested a loan of $500 to buy chicks and feed. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to buy more chicks for breeding. In the future, Susan plans to target an output of 4,000 birds in one month.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shamraiz

texts.en: Shamraiz is 34 years old, married, and the father of two children. He lives in Gujrat, Pakistan where he has worked as a milkman for the last thirteen years. The income generated by his present herd of cattle is insufficient to cover all of his household expenses, so he wants to expand his business and is requesting this loan to make that possible. He is known locally for the quality of his products, and is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their assistance.

loans.use: to expand a milk-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rujeko

texts.en:
Rujeko lives in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe, where she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to students in local schools. For the past nine months, she has also been a businesswoman selling groceries to local residents.

Rujeko wishes to use this Kiva loan to purchase more products and expand into a large retail shop. She hopes that one day she will be able to open her own grocery store and be a major supplier in the district.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for filters, engine oil, and motor spare parts.

loans.name: Faridai

texts.ru: Фаридаи молодая незамужняя девушка в возрасте 24 лет. Она живет в столице с родителями и братьями и сестрами. Фаридаи после окончания школы начала свою швейную деятельность и около 4 года как продолжает заниматься шитьем. В данный момент она работает в ателье. Благодаря своей профессии она каждый день общается с новыми людьми и старается обслуживать своих клиенток быстро и качественно. Фаридаи любит свою профессию, так как она этим зарабатывает на жизнь и помогает родителям с обеспечением семьи. В данный момент родители Фаридаи имеют финансовые трудности и не смогли оплатить за годовой контракт сына, который поступил в ВУЗ в этом году. Фаридаи хочет помочь родителям и брату. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом для того чтобы оплатить за учебу брата. Фаридаи надеется на финансовую поддержку. Она будет оплачивать кредит за своей швейной деятельности.
texts.en: Faridai is a single young woman, 24 years of age. She lives in the capital [of Tajikistan] with her parents, brothers and sister. After finishing secondary school, Faridai started working as a seamstress. She has been in this line of work for four years. At present she is employed in a sewing shop. Thanks to her trade she meets new people every day and always tries to provide efficient and high-quality service to her customers. Faridai enjoys her work since this is her way to make a living and help out her parents financially. At present Faridai's parents are experiencing financial difficulties; they are unable to pay the tuition of their son, who was admitted to college this year. Faridai wants to help her parents and brother. Thus she has applied for a loan in order to pay for her brother's tuition. Faridai hopes to obtain financial support. She will be repaying her loan from her income as a seamstress.

loans.use: to pay the annual college tuition for her younger brother.

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en: Hayde is a 46-year-old, married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is a mother of five children. Hayde has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is their main source of income. Hayde is asking for a loan to buy hardwood, nails, adhesive, plywood and "kasko," a lower part of the fishing boat. With this loan, they will be able to improve their catch, thus allowing them to sell more fish in the market. Hayde dreams of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy hardwood, nails, adhesive, plywood and "kasko."

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en: Rose Mary settled to live in Misamis Occidental with her family. She helps her husband working in their own farm to make a living. She grows vegetables and sells them in the market. She has plans to cultivate a vacant lot for expansion of her garden. Rose Mary joined GDMPC and has borrowed a new loan to purchase additional seedlings and manure fertilizer. Improving their farm is her best way in earning more income that will enable her to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and manure fertilizer.

loans.name: Odete

texts.en: Odete is married and is the mother of two children. She is also a businesswoman who runs a general store. She started this business in 2012 with her own working capital of $500, and now earns a good income because many people like buying from her.  Odete is requesting a $600 loan from Tuba Rai Metin to increase her income and improve her business. She will use the loan to buy additional items to sell, including slippers, boots, knives, men's and women's belts, and bags.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La socia Mariluz se sigue dedicando al negocio de cafetin,la socia prepara tortas,pasteles y gelatinas,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tortas,pasteles y gelatinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mariluz keeps working at her business, running a small café.  She makes sandwiches, cakes, and gelatin.  She wants to get ahead through her business.  At this point she has been in this business for a number of years.  She is asking for this loan to buy sandwiches, cakes, and gelatin.

She is happy for the loan and is committed to making her established payments.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, cakes, and gelatin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance and clearing the land where he grows cacao
